notes: On 23 July 2021, demonstrators gathered on the main street of Gedaref city (Madeinat Al Gedaref locality, Gedaref state) and barricaded road with rocks and burning tires. The demonstrators demanded the Governor of the states to address the excavation of ancient tombs and agricultural land, and demanded that farmers who have occupied the land be removed by authorities. Some windows of vehicles were smashed by the demonstrators. [size=no report]

On 23 July 2021, three teenage pastoralists (described as being from the Fellata/Mbororo ethnic group) were abducted by Amhara militia close to Gallabat town (Basundah locality, Gedaref state), reportedly for ransom.

On 22 July 2021, armed men on motorbikes looted livestock and farming equipment from Hillat Bashir village (one source says Fulo village) in Kutum locality (North Darfur state), and beat four farmers (one report says one of the farmers was shot). Two of the attackers were later arrested.

On 21 July 2021, pastoralists and farmers clashed in Roro (Al Tadamon locality, Bule Nile state), after pastoralists invaded agricultural lands, indicating that the events took a dangerous turn after the use of weapons and light machine guns. One person was killed, and a number of people (with estimate ranging between 5 and 27 people) were injured.

On 21 July 2021, former employees of the Civil Aviation Authority who were dismissed from their jobs demonstrated in Khartoum (Khartoum state). The demonstrators demanded salaries dating back to January 2021, and to also receive their Eid grant. [size=no report]
On 21 July 2021, local residents carried a demonstration during the Eid al-Adha celebration and demanded the recovery of the lands of the Hamadab area of Khartoum (Khartoum state). [size=no report]

On 20 July 2021, demonstrators gathered in Maqta area [coded to Gedaref, Madeinat Al Gedaref locality, Gedaref state], warning against the destruction of forest and announced the protection the elephant forest. [size=no report]

On 20 July 2021, hundreds of demonstrators gathered in El Fasher city (Al Fasher locality, North Darfur state), denouncing the recent violence at Sortony, and calling for increased protection for the internally displaced. [size=hundreds]

On 20 July 2021, dozens of demonstrators (including Resistance Committee members) gathered in Nyala city (Nyala Janoub locality, South Darfur state), demanding the resignation of the governor of South Darfur, and an end to the appointment of governors from the capital city. Police arrested three demonstrators. [size=dozens]

actor1: Military Forces of Sudan (2019-) Rapid Support Forces
assoc_actor_1: PDF: Popular Defence Forces; Hawazmah-Dar Ali-Sub-Clan Group (Sudan); Baggara Ethnic Group (Sudan)
notes: On 19 July 2021, members of the Dar Ali section of the Hawazmah Baggara clan, who were described as wearing the uniforms of RSF and PDF paramilitaries (and have been coded as such), attacked civilians from Kawahala ethnic group in Kologi town (Ghadeer locality, South Kordofan state). Six people were killed. The violence is the latest in a series of events in and around the town.

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Sudan (2019-) Rapid Support Forces
notes: Around 19 July 2021 (as reported), a spate of attacks by unspecified attackers against farmers and returning IDPs was reported in Bielel locality (Beliel, South Darfur state), killing 'about' 7 people and wounding dozens. Two resettlement towns were also torched, including the town of Dashisha (no geographic information found), with RSF paramilitaries implicated in the burning of Dashisha.

actor1: SLM/A-Peace and Development: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Peace and Development Faction)
actor2: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
notes: On 18 July 2021, SLM/A-Nur rebels once again clashed with members of a splinter group (under the command of Sadiq al-Fakka, known as SLM/A Peace and Development) which is aligned to the government at Sortony camp (Kebkabiya locality, North Darfur state). 'About' 17 people were killed and 9 or 10 wounded (some seriously) during two days of fighting, who mostly appear to be IDPs, whilst shops were looted and houses torched. Shelling was also reported during the clashes, and an unspecified number were displaced by the violence. Note that one source says unspecified regular (government) forces were involved, but this is not confirmed at the present time. Fatalities distributed across two events.
On 18 July 2021, unidentified gunmen shot and killed a police officer (assume off-duty) in Abdullah Al-Sheikh village (Rabak locality, White Nile state) [coded to Rabak].

actor1: Military Forces of Sudan (2019-) Rapid Support Forces
notes: Looting: On 17 July 2021, about two hundred (200) armed people dressed in RSF and PDF paramilitaries uniforms invaded gold mine markets at Bajoun and Gardood Toro (Ghadeer locality, South Kordofan state). They looted the shops goods, other valuable items including money and smart phones from civilians. Suspected to be Dar Ali/ Hawazma.

actor1: SLM/A-Peace and Development: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Peace and Development Faction)
actor2: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
notes: On 17 July 2021, SLM/A-Nur rebels clashed with members of a splinter group (under the command of Sadiq al-Fakka, known as SLM/A Peace and Development) which is aligned to the government at Sortony camp (Kebkabiya locality, North Darfur state), after the pro-govt faction attacked the camp earlier that day. 'About' 17 people were killed and 9 or 10 wounded (some seriously) during two days of fighting, who mostly appear to be IDPs, whilst shops were looted and houses torched. Shelling was also reported during the clashes, and an unspecified number were displaced by the violence. Note that one source says unspecified regular (government) forces were involved, but this is not confirmed at the present time. Fatalities distributed across two events.
On 17 July 2021, members from the Nuer ethnic and Dinka ethnic clashed in a refugee camp in Jabal Aulia (Jebel Awlia locality, Khartoum state). One person was killed.

On 16 July 2021, armed pastoralists fired upon rickshaws that were travelling to the market at Dito in the area of Dakama (Gereida, South Darfur state), killing one or two people. There is no clear motive for the attack.

On 16 July 2021, members from the Nuer ethnic and Dinka ethnic clashed at the refugee camp in Jabal Aulia (Jebel Awlia locality, Khartoum state), in what appears to have been an escalation from an argument during a ceremony organized by Nuer refugees. Two people were killed.

Around 16 July 2021 (as reported), Resistance Committee members organized demonstrations in Gedaref city (Madeinat Al Gedaref locality, Gedaref state), calling for the dismissal the Director General of Health and the resignation of the governor of Gedaref state, after more than hundred health workers resign in Gedaref. [size=no report]

On 15 July 2021, armed pastoralists attacked a farming community at Habouba village in Gereida locality (South Darfur state), described as being 15km west of Gereida town [coded to Moshrou], killing 3 and wounding 2. Agricultural produce and livestock were also stolen. The attack took the form of a pincer movement.

On 15 July 2021, SAF and SAF Reservists fought with unspecified Ethiopian armed forces (coded as ENDF pending further information) in the area of Jebel Abu Tiyour (Al Qureisha locality, Gedaref state). Sudanese sources report that Ethiopian forces suffered 'heavy losses' and were repulsed, although there is no specific information on the numbers killed or wounded. Unknown number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 15 July 2021, Dar Ali section of the Hawazmah clan (of the Baggara ethnic group) gathered from different areas and invaded Almajid neighborhood of Kologi town (Ghadeer locality, South Kordofan), and burnt many of houses belonging to Kawahala tribe while firing on air. The attack comes amid escalating violence involving the two groups. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

On 15 July 2021, Dar Ali section of the Hawazmah clan (of the Baggara ethnic group) shot and killed two civilians from the Kawahala tribe in Gardood Toro town (Ghadeer locality, South Kordofan). Three others were injured. The attack comes amid escalating violence involving the two groups.

On 15 July 2021, lawyers and the families of victims of the Ramadan massacre protested in front of the Public Prosecution office in Khartoum (Khartoum state). They demanded the resignation of the public prosecutor, after he was accused of preventing forensic investigators from Argentina from assisting Sudanese investigations into the killings. [size=no report]

On 14 July 2021, 'about ten' supporters of the disbanded NCP demonstrated at the market in Ed Daein city (Ad Duayn locality, East Darfur state), with police arresting four officials linked to the former regime who were present at the demonstration. [size=about 10]

assoc_actor_2: Hawazmah-Dar Ali-Sub-Clan Group (Sudan); Baggara Ethnic Group (Sudan)
notes: On 14 July 2021, members of Kawahala ethnic militia attacked and burnt two houses belonging to Dar Ali section of the Hawazmah clan (of the Baggara ethnic group) near Kologi town (Ghadeer locality, South Kordofan). Members of Kawahala tribe shifted (moved) their families from Kologi to Gadier. The attack comes amid escalating violence involving the two groups. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

On 14 July 2021, employees of the Ministry of Culture protested demanding the dismissal of the Minister of Culture in Khartoum (Khartoum state), amid what they describe as an abrupt deterioration of the Ministry. [size=no report]

Around 13 July 2021 (as reported), activists held a peaceful protest in solidarity with the events of Red Sea state demanding peaceful coexistence between communities in Gedaref city (Madeinat Al Gedaref locality, Gedaref state). [size=no report]

source: Sudan Akhbar; Al Rakoba; Radio Dabanga
notes: On 13 July 2021, mining police officers and armed forces (coded as SAF) clashed with an unidentified group at the market in Delgo town (Delgo locality, Northern state). One soldier was killed and three police officers were wounded. The armed group is described as both a group who signed the JPA and as an unspecified tribal group. They have previously been linked to violent behavior at Mount Abu Ghazaleh two weeks prior to the event.

On 13 July 2021, local street vendors protests against the authorities who launched campaigns against them to prevent them from practicing their activity along Jackson's street in Khartoum (Khartoum state). At least 17 people were arrested by police. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_2: Hawazmah-Dar Ali-Sub-Clan Group (Sudan); Baggara Ethnic Group (Sudan)
notes: On 13 July 2021, members of Kawahala ethnic militia shot and killed a civilian belonging to the Dar Ali section of the Hawazmah clan (of the Baggara ethnic group) at Gerami market of Kologi town (Ghadeer locality, South Kordofan). The attack comes amid escalating violence involving the two groups.

On 13 July 2021, Dar Ali section of the Hawazmah clan (of the Baggara ethnic group) shot and killed two civilians from the Kawahala tribe at Almajid neighborhood of Kologi town (Ghadeer locality, South Kordofan). The attack comes amid escalating violence involving the two groups.

Around 13 July 2021 (as reported), a number of expatriates demonstrated at the Ministry of Finance, denouncing the customs tariff for importing cars in in Khartoum (Khartoum state). This follows several similar demonstrations in recent months. [size=no report]
On 12 July 2021, Resistance Committees demonstrated in Nyala city (Nyala Janoub locality, South Darfur state), calling for the dismissal of the governor of the state. [size=no report]

Around 12 July 2021 (as reported), demonstrators marched in Port Sudan (Port Sudan locality, Red Sea state), demanding that the state Security Committee and public prosecutor intervene to resolve recent acts of violent conflict in the city. [size=no report]

Around 12 July 2021 (as reported), a Native Administrator organized a demonstration in Beida town (Beida locality, West Darfur state) after humanitarian vehicles were accused of speeding in the streets of the town. SAF personnel intervened in the demonstration, and physically and verbally assaulted the Administrator. The assault resulted in clashes between the demonstrators and soldiers, with the demonstrators commandeering two military vehicles equipped with heavy machine guns, and seizing six assault rifles. Civilian authorities intervened and secured the return of the vehicles; the six assault rifles were not returned. [size=no report]

On 12 July 2021, Dar Ali section of the Hawazmah clan (of the Baggara ethnic group) assaulted a tractor driver from Kawahala tribe, after they confiscated his tractor. The event occurred Alshabaka close to Kologi town (Ghadeer locality, South Kordofan state). The tractor was retrieved by the victim's ethnic kin.

On 11 July 2021, unknown gunmen shot a civilian at an unspecified location described as being 10km north of Nertiti town (Gharb Jabal Marrah locality, Central Darfur state) [coded to Komong]. The victim was wounded in the back, and taken to hospital. There is no clear motivation for the attack.

On 11 July 2021, Amhara militia and unspecified Ethiopian soldiers (provisionally coded as ENDF) crossed into Basundah locality (Gedaref state), implied to be in the areas of Haskanet and Umm Diblo in the southern part of the locality close to the disputed border [coded to Haskanet]. The militia were repulsed by SAF and SAF Reservists; there is no information regarding casualties or fatalities.

On 10 July 2021, demonstrators (including Resistance Committee members) gathered at the Governor's residence in Gedaref city (Madeinat Al Gedaref locality, Gedaref state), calling for his dismissal amid a collapse of the health system in the state, following mass resignations of doctors, shortages of essential medical provisions and drugs, and the failure to treat kidney patients. Police beat a senior member of the Gedaref city Resistance Committee at the demonstration. [size=no report]

On 10 July 2021, unidentified gunmen threw two hand grenades at Prince's Sports Club in the Salbouna area in Port Sudan (Port Sudan locality, Red Sea state). Three people were killed by the grenade, with a fourth dying of their injuries on 13 July. A woman was also killed by the attackers as they fled the scene. The violence comes amid increasing turbulence in the city, in light of recent clashes between the Beni Amir and Nuba groups.

On 10 July 2021, an elderly man was executed by unknown attackers whilst travelling on a bus in Port Sudan (Port Sudan locality, Red Sea state) and his body dumped on the road, amid violence between Beni Amir and Nuba groups in recent days. Two more people were injured later in the day by unknown gunmen and two vehicles were torched, during the funeral procession for the victim. Note that one source describes the incident as coming from a brawl that took place on the bus, though the event is provisionally coded as an attack pending further information.

On 10 July 2021, a suspected Dar Ali section of the Hawazmah clan (of the Baggara ethnic group) shot and killed two civilians from Kawahala ethnic group traveling from Gadier to Kao at an unspecified location (Ghadeer locality, South Kordofan state) [coded to Khor el Waja]. The attack comes amid escalating violence involving the two groups.

On 10 July 2021, demonstrators gathered in Port Sudan (Port Sudan locality, Red Sea state) and blocked the road to the airport (through unspecified means), to denounce attacks in the city earlier that day that resulted in one death and two injuries. Unspecified joint forces (coded as police and army) dispersed the demonstrators. [size=no report]

On 9 July 2021, local residents marched and demanded the recovery of the lands of the Hamadab are of Khartoum (Khartoum state). The demonstrators began a sit-in protest which has lasted at least four days. [size=no report]

Around 9 July 2021 (as reported), activists held a demonstration in front of the Council of Ministers and the court in Kassala city (Madeinat Kassala locality, Kassala state) denouncing recent violence in Port Sudan, and demanding the removal of the Red Sea governor and members of the Security Committee. [size=no report]

On 9 July 2021, armed people from Kawahala and Kenana ethnic militia attacked Dar Ali section of the Hawazmah clan (of the Baggara ethnic group) nomadic camp near Kologi town (Ghadeer locality, South Kordofan state). Twenty people were killed and injured many others including one from attackers. The attack was in response to an earlier attack by Hawazmah-Dar Ali sub clan. SAF soldiers were reported not to have intervened in the violence.

On 9 July 2021, Tigrayan refugees demonstrated at the refugee camp in Tunaydbah (Al Mafaza locality, Gedaref state), after WFP food aid given to the refugees was to be replaced by cash (amid high inflation and foot shortages in Sudan). An official has said that some essential nutritional support will be given to mothers and children. [size=no report]

On 9 July 2021, Tigrayan refugees demonstrated at Umm Rakoba Refugee Camp (Galabat Ash-Shargiah locality, Gedaref state), after WFP food aid given to the refugees was to be replaced by cash (amid high inflation and foot shortages in Sudan). An official has said that some essential nutritional support will be given to mothers and children. [size=no report]

On 8 July 2021, members of the Dar Ali section of the Hawazmah clan of the Baggara clashed with members of the Kawahala in Kologi town (Ghadeer locality, South Kordofan state), following escalating tensions between the two groups. At least 13 were killed across two days of clashes (with fatalities split over two events) and an unknown number wounded.

source: Sudan Tribune; Sudan Akhbar; Radio Dabanga
notes: On 8 July 2021, 'tribal' violence between unspecified ethnic groups (presumed to be Beni Amir and Nuba, given the locations in which fighting took place) continued in the Dar al-Naim/Mirghania neighborhood of Port Sudan (Port Sudan locality, Red Sea state). SAF and Abu Tira (a.k.a. Central Reserve Police) intervened in the clashes (implied to be on the side of one of the clashing groups, although it is unclear which group was being supported). At least one person was killed on 6 July (with three being killed across three days of fighting, and fatalities distributed across three events) and at least 14 were wounded, whilst several houses were torched and roads barricaded. Authorities claimed to be engaging in policing operations against 'gangs'.

Around 8 July 2021 (as reported), medical students from the Nile Valley University in Atbara city (Atbara locality, River Nile state) began a sit-in protest at the university, calling for the institution to reopen and for studying to resume. [size=no report]

On 7 July 2021, members of the Dar Ali section of the Hawazmah clan of the Baggara clashed with members of the Kawahala in Kologi town (Ghadeer locality, South Kordofan state), following escalating tensions between the two groups. At least 13 were killed across two days of clashes (with fatalities split over two events) and an unknown number wounded.

source: Sudan Akhbar; Sudan Tribune; Radio Dabanga
notes: On 7 July 2021, 'tribal' violence between unspecified ethnic groups (presumed to be Beni Amir and Nuba, given the locations in which fighting took place) continued in the Dar al-Naim/Mirghania neighborhood of Port Sudan (Port Sudan locality, Red Sea state). SAF and Abu Tira (a.k.a. Central Reserve Police) intervened in the clashes (implied to be on the side of one of the clashing groups, although it is unclear which group was being supported). At least one person was killed on 6 July (with three being killed across three days of fighting, and fatalities distributed across three events) and at least 14 were wounded, whilst several houses were torched and roads barricaded. Authorities claimed to be engaging in policing operations against 'gangs'.

On 7 July 2021, unknown gunmen killed an IDP and wounded another in the area of Kalima Al Hilla as the victims were travelling back to Kalma IDP Camp (Beliel locality, South Darfur state; coordinates used at GP2). There is no further information.

Around 7 July 2021 (as reported), 'Janjaweed' (coded as Rizeigat militia) attacked and killed an IDP at Artala (Mukjar locality, Central Darfur state). There is no further information on the incident.

source: Radio Dabanga; Sudan Tribune; Sudan Akhbar
notes: On 6 July 2021, 'tribal' violence between unspecified ethnic groups (presumed to be Beni Amir and Nuba, given the locations in which fighting took place) occured in the Dar al-Naim/Mirghania neighborhood of Port Sudan (Port Sudan locality, Red Sea state). SAF and Abu Tira (a.k.a. Central Reserve Police) intervened in the clashes (implied to be on the side of one of the clashing groups, although it is unclear which group was being supported). At least one person was killed on 6 July (with three being killed across three days of fighting, and fatalities distributed across three events) and at least 14 were wounded, whilst several houses were torched and roads barricaded. Authorities claimed to be engaging in policing operations against 'gangs'.

On 6 July 2021, a cattle raid involving the two groups of the Dar Ali section of the Hawazmah clan of the Baggara and the Kawahala took place at an unspecified location in Ghadeer locality (South Kordofan state) [coded to Kologi]. It is not clear who instigated the raid, and the event is coded here as an armed clash pending further information. There is no information regarding fatalities or casualties.
Around 6 July 2021 (as reported), university lecturers protested in Khartoum (Khartoum state), calling for improvements to pay and for pay scales to be standardized. [size=no report]

On 6 July 2021, members of Dar Ali section of the Hawazmah clan (of the Baggara ethnic group) shot three projectiles (presumed to be small arms fire) which fell at Jabarouna neighborhood of Kologi town (Ghadeer locality, South Kordofan state). No fatalities or injuries were reported.

On 5 July 2021, fighting continued between two unspecified ethnic groups (one of whom is presumed to be Zaghawa) at the Selea area of Jebel Moon locality (West Darfur state). Across four days of fighting, one person was killed and five were wounded. There is no further information on the clashes. Fatality is coded on the 2nd.

On 5 July 2021, residents of the Baleela area began a sit-in demonstration at Baleela Airport (Al Lagowa locality, West Kordofan state), calling for Petro Energy Company (based near to the airport) to provided compensation and jobs to the local community. The demonstrators prevented oil workers from accessing the nearby oil facility, through unspecified means. [size=no report].

Mass grave: Around 5 July 2021 (as reported), three mass graves were exhumed at an unspecified location in Wadi Salih locality (Central Darfur state) [coded to Garsila], containing the remains of at least 149 bodies. The head of the Darfur Bar Association has linked the former Janjaweed commander Ali Kushayb to the killings, and also to the former Central Darfur governor Jaafar Abdel Hakam. The precise date of the killings is not specified.

On 5 July 2021, hundreds of Beja demonstrators blocked the Port Sudan-Khartoum highway and Atbara-Port Sudan railway line with burning tires in Sinkat town (Sinkat, Red Sea). The demonstration was in response to the announcement by the High Council of Beja Nazirs against the continued detention of 42 Beja residents in Khartoum for participating in the June 30th parade, as well as the failure of authorities to resolve political and ethnic disputes in Eastern Sudan. [size=hundreds]
Around 5 July 2021 (as reported), demonstrators marched in Ed Daein (Ad Duayn locality, East Darfur state), calling for an end to violence, discrimination, and tribalism. [size=no report]

On 5 July 2021, an unknown armed group clashed with armed pastoralists from West Kordofan at Abu Janouk in or near Abu Zabad locality (West Kordofan state) [coded to Abu Zabad]. The pastoralists repulsed the armed group, killing one and wounding another. The reason for the fighting is unclear, though the population has been now prevented from moving along border areas between government controlled and SPLM-North (Abdelaziz faction) areas.

On 5 July 2021, fighting continued between two unspecified ethnic groups (one of whom is presumed to be Masalit) at the Azerni area of Kereneik locality (West Darfur state). Across four days of fighting, 11 people were killed and 10 were wounded (11 fatalities distributed across four events). There is no further information on the clashes.

Looting: On 5 July 2021, Amhara militia stole around 240 camels from an area near to the Abdullah Al-Shagail farming project in Al Qureisha locality (Gedaref state) [coded to Abu Tiyour]. The raid comes amid renewed militia violence in the disputed territory.

assoc_actor_2: Labour Group (Sudan); WFP: World Food Programme
notes: On 5 July 2021, Amhara militia were reported to have killed three truck drivers and abducted two others in the Azuzu area on the road between Gedaref city and Gallabat town (event presumed to have occurred close to the Sudan-Ethiopia border, and coded to Atrab, Basundah locality, Gedaref state, at GP2). The source indicates that the drivers were working for the World Food Programme and were delivering aid to Tigray; this has been disputed by the UN office in Khartoum, who say that they have not lost any drivers.

On 4 July 2021, fighting continued between two unspecified ethnic groups (one of whom is presumed to be Zaghawa) at the Selea area of Jebel Moon locality (West Darfur state). Across four days of fighting, one person was killed and five were wounded. There is no further information on the clashes. Fatality is coded on the 2nd.

On 4 July 2021, fighting continued in several areas in and around Sirba locality (West Darfur state) between the Tama ethnic group and members of the Awra clan of the Erenga ethnic group, for unclear reasons. Across four days of violence, fighting was reported in the villages of Tangki, Tambasi, Hashaba (on 3 and 4 July), Radda, Meiram, Hami, Ammar Jadid, Dertik Krekar, Kefani/Kafani, and Karkar [coded to Sirba]. At least 21 people are reported to have been killed (7 of whom were killed on 3 July), and dozens wounded. Seven of the villages where fighting occurred were torched, and livestock was looted. 21 fatalities distributed across six events, 7 of which are coded to two events on 3 July.

On 4 July 2021, fighting continued between two unspecified ethnic groups (one of whom is presumed to be Masalit) at the Azerni area of Kereneik locality (West Darfur state). Across four days of fighting, 11 people were killed and 10 were wounded (11 fatalities distributed across four events). There is no further information on the clashes.

On 4 July 2021, four unidentified gunmen attacked the Christian Affairs Minister advisor in square next to Al-Salameh grocery area south of Khartoum (Khartoum State). He was beaten with the back of the gun and insulted with profanity and threatened with liquidation if he did not stop opening church files with the Disempowerment Committee and the Ministry of Religious Affairs.

On 4 July 2021, armed pastoralists shot and wounded a coal miner near Dobo Umda (Tawila locality, North Darfur state), before looting property belongings from other miners. The attack comes amid escalating insecurity in the area.
Around 4 July 2021 (as reported), five unknown gunmen abducted two security guards and stole their vehicle at Diffra Oil Field in the disputed Abyei area. There is no further information.

On 4 July 2021, two militias clashed with guns and bladed weapons near the Al Barsaya oil field close to El Fula town (El Salam locality, West Kordofan state), with one of the groups (who were farming the land) being attacked by the other. 10 people were injured in the clash.

On 4 July 2021, fighting continued in several areas in and around Sirba locality (West Darfur state) between the Tama ethnic group and members of the Awra clan of the Erenga ethnic group, for unclear reasons. Across four days of violence, fighting was reported in the villages of Tangki, Tambasi, Hashaba (in northern El Geneina locality, on 3 and 4 July), Radda, Meiram, Hami, Ammar Jadid, Dertik Krekar, Kefani/Kafani, and Karkar. At least 21 people are reported to have been killed (7 of whom were killed on 3 July), and dozens wounded. Seven of the villages where fighting occurred were torched, and livestock was looted. 21 fatalities distributed across six events, 7 of which are coded to two events on 3 July.

Around 4 July 2021 (as reported), members of the Al Lahuin ethnic group clashed with Amhara militias at an unspecified location in Basundah locality (Gedaref state) [coded to Gallabat], with SAF soldiers intervening on the side of the Al Lahuin. Two members of the Al Lahuin were wounded, and treated by the army in Gallabat town. The Al Lahuin claim the Amhara were conducting a kidnapping raid in the area.

On 3 July 2021, fighting continued between two unspecified ethnic groups (one of whom is presumed to be Zaghawa) at the Selea area of Jebel Moon locality (West Darfur state). Across four days of fighting, one person was killed and five were wounded. There is no further information on the clashes. Fatality is coded on the 2nd.

On 3 July 2021, fighting continued in several areas in and around Sirba locality (West Darfur state) between the Tama ethnic group and members of the Awra clan of the Erenga ethnic group, for unclear reasons. Across four days of violence, fighting was reported in the villages of Tangki, Tambasi, Hashaba (in northern El Geneina locality, on 3 and 4 July), Radda, Meiram, Hami, Ammar Jadid, Dertik Krekar, Kefani/Kafani, and Karkar. At least 21 people are reported to have been killed (7 of whom were killed on 3 July), and dozens wounded. Seven of the villages where fighting occurred were torched, and livestock was looted. 21 fatalities distributed across six events, 7 of which are coded to two events on 3 July.

Across four days of violence, fighting was reported in the villages of Tangki, Tambasi, Hashaba (on 3 and 4 July), Radda, Meiram, Hami, Ammar Jadid, Dertik Krekar, Kefani/Kafani, and Karkar [coded to Sirba]. At least 21 people are reported to have been killed (7 of whom were killed on 3 July), and dozens wounded. Seven of the villages where fighting occurred were torched, and livestock was looted. 21 fatalities distributed across six events, 7 of which are coded to two events on 3 July.

Across four days of fighting, 11 people were killed and 10 were wounded (11 fatalities distributed across four events). There is no further information on the clashes.

On 2 July 2021, fighting continued in several areas in and around Sirba locality (West Darfur state) between the Tama ethnic group and members of the Awra clan of the Erenga ethnic group, for unclear reasons. Across four days of violence, fighting was reported in the villages of Tangki, Tambasi, Hashaba (on 3 and 4 July), Radda, Meiram, Hami, Ammar Jadid, Dertik Krekar, Kefani/Kafani, and Karkar [coded to Sirba]. At least 21 people are reported to have been killed (7 of whom were killed on 3 July), and dozens wounded. Seven of the villages where fighting occurred were torched, and livestock was looted. 21 fatalities distributed across six events, 7 of which are coded to two events on 3 July.

On 2 July 2021, fighting began between two unspecified ethnic groups (one of whom is presumed to be Masalit) at the Azerni area of Kereneik locality (West Darfur state). Across four days of fighting, 11 people were killed and 10 were wounded (11 fatalities distributed across four events). There is no further information on the clashes.

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Sudan (2019-) Rapid Support Forces
notes: On 2 July 2021, two groups from the Khorasan neighborhood clashed in El Obeid city (Sheikan locality, North Kordofan). One person was killed and another one injured in the armed clash, which involved small arms and RPGs. RSF paramilitaries were reported to have been involved in the fighting, though specific information regarding the cause of the clashes (and RSF involvement) is lacking.

On 2 July 2021, fighting began between two unspecified ethnic groups (one of whom is presumed to be Zaghawa) at the Selea area of Jebel Moon locality (West Darfur state). Across four days of fighting, one person was killed and five were wounded. There is no further information on the clashes.

On 1 July 2021, regular forces (presumed to be SAF) shot and killed three South Sudanese civilians (who hail from an unspecified area(s) of Upper Nile state) in Omdurman (Omdurman locality, Khartoum state), a day after South Sudanese civilians had prevented drunken soldiers from entering their house. The attackers then went to the nearby market, killing two residents of the area (coded as Sudanese) and wounding 'dozens', and burning shops. Authorities arrested the culprits, who were subsequently released.

On 1 July 2021, fighting broke out in several areas in and around Sirba locality (West Darfur state) between the Tama ethnic group and members of the Awra clan of the Erenga ethnic group, for unclear reasons. Across four days of violence, fighting was reported in the villages of Tangki, Tambasi, Hashaba (on 3 and 4 July), Radda, Meiram, Hami, Ammar Jadid, Dertik Krekar, Kefani/Kafani, and Karkar [coded to Sirba]. At least 21 people are reported to have been killed (7 of whom were killed on 3 July), and dozens wounded. Seven of the villages where fighting occurred were torched, and livestock was looted. 21 fatalities distributed across six events, 7 of which are coded to two events on 3 July.
On 1 July 2021, journalists and Resistance Committee members demonstrated in Nyala city (Nyala Janoub locality, South Darfur state). The reason for the demonstration is unspecified. [size=no report]

Some demonstrators called for the RSF to be integrated into SAF. On 12 June 2021, a group of people in Port Sudan (Port Sudan, Red Sea) assaulted a university professor with a machete in the context of tribal conflicts in the southern neighborhoods. On 12 June 2021, members of Dar Ali section of the Hawazmah clan (of the Baggara ethnic group) assaulted a tractor driver from Kawahala tribe at the area of Alshabaka to the north of Kologi town (Ghadeer locality, South Kordofan state). On 12 June 2021, a group of about 150 people gathered in demonstration against the increase of fuel prices in Al Kalakla (Jebel Awlia, Khartoum). Some shops and restaurants were destroyed and stones were thrown at cars. [size=about 150]

Around 11 June 2021 (as reported), Sudanese expatriates who had recently returned to Sudan demonstrated in Khartoum (Khartoum state), after the Minister of Trade issued an edict preventing the importation of cars into the country (which would affect the vehicles they had been intending to bring back to the country with them). On 10 June 2021, members of the Al Jazirah Farmers Association demonstrated in Barakat (Janub Al Jazirah locality, Al Jazirah state), calling for greater assistance to distressed farmers, and highlighting the negative effects the removal of fuel subsidies will have for agricultural production. On 10 June 2021, mass demonstrations (including Resistance Committee members) were reported in Rabak city (Rabak locality, White Nile state), calling for the dismissal of the governor and other senior figures in the state administration, amid ongoing economic turmoil. [size=no report]

On 10 June 2021, residents of Al-Ma'ali demonstrated at the Electricity Distribution Company offices in Khartoum (Khartoum state), condemning the lengthy delays to a project which was supposed to introduce electricity and electric lights to the neighborhood, which began seven or eight years ago. [size=no report]
On 10 June 2021, hundreds of demonstrators gathered in Ed Daein (Ad Duayn locality, East Darfur state), denouncing soaring fuel prices as well as fuel shortages. [size=hundreds]
On 9 June 2021, children suffering from cancer and their parents demonstrated against shortages of essential medication at the Ministry of Health in Khartoum (Khartoum state). [size=no report]

On 9 June 2021, pastoralists of the Dar Ali section of the Hawazmah clan of the Baggara clashed with Kenana pastoralists in the area of Shabakah in Ghadeer locality (South Kordofan state) [coded to Kologi], killing at least 5 and wounding 'several'. There is no further information at the current time.

assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Sudan (2019-) University Police

One person was killed (who is described as being an ethnic Nuba member of the University Police) and 12 were wounded. Several dwellings were also set on fire.

assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Amhara Regional Special Forces; Amhara Ethnic Militia (Ethiopia)

The Sudanese army has announced that it is deploying additional forces to both Greater and Lesser Fashaga.

On 8 June 2021, Nuba and Beni Amir militias armed with bladed weapons clashed in Port Sudan (Red Sea state), after a dispute involving school children from the two groups escalated. No fatalities were reported, though there is no information regarding the number of wounded.

On 7 June 2021, activists demonstrated in El Fasher city (Al Fasher locality, North Darfur state), demanding justice for two South Sudanese refugees who were killed whilst in detention at the Military Intelligence station. The demonstrators also called for all branches of the security sector as well as rebel movements to desist from interfering in police investigations and impeding judicial independence. [size=no report]

Around 7 June 2021 (as reported), health workers demonstrated at the hospital in Gedaref city (Madeinat Al Gedaref locality, Gedaref state), after a police officer assaulted a doctor on 4 June. [size=no report]
On 6 June 2021, two Masalit men were killed by unknown gunmen in El Geneina city (El Geniena locality, West Darfur state), for unclear reasons.

On 6 June 2021, a man stabbed and killed a 16 year-old Resistance Committee member who was a participant of the ongoing sit-in demonstration at the hospital in Khartoum (Khartoum state). The suspect has since been arrested. [size=no report]

On 6 June 2021, 'limited' demonstrations took place in El Fula town (El Salam locality, West Kordofan state), with demonstrators calling for the state to remain independent of other regions of Sudan. The demonstrators are presumably concerned about upcoming administrative changes outlined under the Juba Peace Agreement, which may see the relatively new state of West Kordofan merged with other parts of Kordofan. [size=limited]
On 6 June 2021, former government bank workers who had been dismissed under the Bashir regime demonstrated in Khartoum (Khartoum state), calling for their reinstatement. [size=no report]

On 6 June 2021, looters returned to the former UNAMID base at Shangil Tobay (Dar As Salam locality, North Darfur state), but were fired upon by unspecified government forces (presumed to be SAF, pending further information), killing 3 and wounding 'dozens'. [size=no report]

On 5 June 2021, residents of El Ubaiyid in River Nile state (presumed to be the location of the same name in Shendi locality, and coded as such as GP2. Note that one source says the location is in Berber locality to the north) began a sit-in protest against environmental damage caused by mining which lasted three days. The demonstrators closed down the gold market and disrupted the operations of the Sudanese Mineral Resources Company. The demonstrators were also calling for improvements in housing and basic services; for mining to bring employment benefits to residents of the area; and for the 25 villages which comprise the area to be turned into an administrative locality of their own. [size=no report]

At least 35 are reported to have been killed (one source says 42) including one SAF soldier and five RSF paramilitaries, whilst at least 32 were wounded (one source says 47). Insecurity is reported to be continuing in the area.

On 5 June 2021, a SAF soldier opened fire at the military base in Zalingei city (Zalingi locality, Central Darfur state), killing a SAF colonel and seriously wounding three other soldiers. There are reported to be conflicting accounts of the attacker's motivation.

Around 5 June 2021 (as reported), Amhara militia killed two Sudanese farmers at an area described as being to the east of Gallabat town (Basundah locality, Gedaref state), after the farmers resisted an attempt at abducting them.

source: Darfur 24; Radio Dabanga; Sudan Tribune; Ayin Network

Police fired tear gas against the demonstrators, a small number of whom threw stones and molotov cocktails at the police. A policeman was also shot and killed during the demonstration by an unknown person. [size=thousands]

Demonstrators burned tires in front of administrative buildings in the city center. [size=hundreds]

On 3 June 2021, demonstrators (including Resistance Committee members) gathered in the city of Zalingei (Zalingi locality, Central Darfur state) as part of nationwide demonstrations, calling for justice for the victims of the June 3rd massacre of 2019 and a correction in the course of the revolution, as well as for the reversal of the deterioration in living standards. [size=no report]

On 3 June 2021, demonstrators (including Communist Party supporters and Resistance Committee members) gathered in Ed Damazin (Ed Damazine locality, Blue Nile state), calling for justice for the victims of the June 3rd massacre of 2019; for the economic crisis to be resolved; and for the end of the current government. [size=no report]

Around 2 June 2021 (as reported), three members of the SLM/A Minnawi faction were ambushed by an unknown group at an unspecified location in North Darfur state [coded to state capital El Fasher, Al Fasher locality], with an SLM/A officer dying of his wounds after being taken to the hospital in El Fasher.
