On 1 June 2021, unknown gunmen fired upon the convoy carrying the Executive Director of Central Jebel Marra locality at Taringa (Gharb Jabal Marrah locality, Central Darfur state), wounding him and three others travelling in the convoy.

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Sudan (2019-); Bargo Ethnic Group (Sudan)
notes: On 1 June 2021, members of the Jumeeya ethnic group killed 5 members of the Bargo ethnic group (2 of whom died later from their wounds) and wounded 16 (including a police officer) in the town of Dibebad (Al Quoz locality, South Kordofan state). The attack began in a cafe, where the attackers targeted members of the Bargo in retaliation for an incident in which one of their ethnic kin had been involved in. The attackers then fired indiscriminately in the town.

On 31 May 2021, IDPs demonstrated at Kalma IDP Camp (Beliel locality, South Darfur state), during an organized visit by the Prosecutor of the International Criminal Court. The demonstrators called for several figures linked to crimes against humanity in Darfur - including Ahmed Haroun - to face trial at the ICC. [size=no report]

Around 31 May 2021 (as reported), Amhara militiamen established a road block in the Khor Yabus/Yabis area of Basundah locality (Gedaref state) [coded to Mashra Tuklayn], executing two Sudanese farmers. The incident comes amid ongoing tensions in the disputed area.

Around 31 May 2021 (as reported), Amhara militiamen abducted a Sudanese shepherd east of the Atbara river at a location described as being in the vicinity of Khor Al-Jir [coded to Safarah, Al Qureisha locality, Gedaref state]. The abduction comes amid ongoing tensions in the disputed area.

On 29 May 2021, hundreds of ethnic Fur (at least some of whom were related to a trader killed the previous day) engaged in a number of acts of disorder and violence in Foro Burunga town (Foro Baranga locality, West Darfur state), beating the Executive Director of the locality and looting and torching several administrative buildings and shops after authorities failed to arrest the killers of the trader. The events sparked several hours of clashes between Fur and Arab (presumed to be Rizeigat) militias in the town, killing a total of 11 (note that it is unclear whether the figure includes the trader killed the previous day - 10 fatalities coded pending clarification) and wounding 7. At least 3 of the deceased were Rizeigat killed at the start of the disorder, who responded by attacking a hospital and killing Fur who were being treated for injuries. Security forces have deployed heavily in the town.

Around 29 May 2021 (as reported), militiamen (described as being affiliated to the former regime) killed one person and wounded 15 at an unspecified location in Kebkabiya locality (North Darfur state). The incident was announced by representatives of IDPs in the area, though it is not clear whether IDPs were targeted in the events. There is no further information.

Around 29 May 2021 (as reported), Amhara militia killed a Sudanese man and abducted his son in the area of Atrab (Basundah locality, Gedaref state). The abduction comes amid ongoing tensions in the disputed area.

On 28 May 2021, unknown attackers killed an ethnic Fur trader at the market in Foro Burunga town (Foro Baranga locality, West Darfur state). Security services pursued the attackers, but did not succeed in apprehending them. The motive for the killing is unclear.

Around 28 May 2021 (as reported), two groups of residents clashed in Atra (Medani Al Kubra locality, Al Jazirah state), after a dispute between two students escalated. Seven people were wounded in the incident, which security forces broke up. There is no specific information regarding the nature of the dispute. [size=no report]

Around 28 May 2021 (as reported), armed pastoralists killed 4 farmers and wounded 3 others at the Jadal area west of Dilling town (Dilling locality, South Kordofan state). There is no clear motivation for the attack.

Around 27 May 2021 (as reported), a journalist was reported to have been beaten and verbally abused by police in Bahri in Khartoum North (Bahri locality, Khartoum state). There is no further information.
On 26 May 2021, PDF paramilitaries killed 4 farmers and wounded 3 others in an attack that took place near Julud (Dilling locality, South Kordofan state). There is no clear motive for the attack.

On 26 May 2021, large crowds of Resistance Committee members demonstrated in Al Jarif East (Sharg An Neel locality, Khartoum state) and blocked the bridge to Khartoum (through unspecified means), following the identification of a member of the local Resistance Committee (who had been missing since early April) in a morgue. The demonstrators called for justice for those killed in the course of the uprising. [size=large crowds]

On 26 May 2021, SAF and SAF Reservists reportedly fought with unspecified Ethiopian soldiers (provisionally coded as ENDF) and Amhara militiamen at an area described as being south of Umm Dilu and close to Khor Sint, with additional reporting stating the location is in Basundah locality (Gedaref state) [coded to Mashra Tuklayn]. The source states that Ethiopian forces shelled Sudanese forces before engaging in fighting, during an operation to recover territory recently lost to SAF. Sudanese forces reportedly killed an unspecified number from the Ethiopian force (unknown fatalities coded as 3), who then retreated. Sudanese authorities have disputed the clash took place at all.

On 26 May 2021, Taaisha pastoralists clashed with Fellata pastoralists in the Marmusu area of Damso locality (South Darfur state) close to the border with Um Dafoug locality, following an earlier raid by the Fellata three days prior [coded to Mogabi]. 5 people were killed and 3 wounded.

Around 26 May 2021 (as reported), demonstrators gathered in Omdurman (Omdurman locality, Khartoum state), denouncing the longstanding absence of basic services in the area, and calling for the state to provide water, electricity, and security. The demonstrators blocked the road to the University (using unspecified means). [size=no report]
On 25 May 2021, an unknown armed group attacked three security checkpoints in Kadugli town (Kadugli locality, South Kordofan state), killing one police officer. There is no further information.

source: Ayin Network; Sudan Tribune; Radio Dabanga
notes: On 24 May 2021, militia from the Amar'ar clan of the Beja clashed with members of the Almada section of the Beni Amir in several neighborhoods of Port Sudan (Red Sea state), resulting in 4 or 5 deaths and between 11 and 18 being wounded. Bladed weapons were used, whilst several of the dead were reportedly killed by gunfire (allegedly from security services, although no further details are available). A curfew has been enforced, and 8 people arrested. The events follow from an incident the previous evening, and from recurrent violence between the Beja and Beni Amir in Eastern Sudan during 2020.

Around 24 May 2021 (as reported), unknown armed men wearing civilian clothes fired upon the Resistance Committee-organized sit-in protest at 60th Street in Khartoum (Khartoum state), wounding several. The sit-in protest has been in operation since 11 May, and has called for justice for those killed by security forces during and after the uprising. [size=no report]

On 23 May 2021, members of the Beja ethnic group stormed the Sudanese Red Crescent Society HQ in Kassala city (Madeinat Kassala locality, Kassala state), accusing the Society of being run by somebody who is not native to the state, and of being involved in a plot to settle refugees in the area, depriving them of resources. The accusations are likely directed at the Beni Amir ethnic group, who elements of the Beja have portrayed as being 'foreigners' from Eritrea. [size=no report]

On 23 May 2021, Fellata pastoralists raided cattle from Taaisha pastoralists at an unspecified area, at an unspecified area in Damso locality close to the border with Um Dafoug locality in South Darfur [coded to Mogabi]. There do not appear to have been any casualties.

On 23 May 2021, an unspecified group (either Beja or Beni Amir) threw stones at the houses of the other group in the Deem Al-Nour neighborhood of Port Sudan (Red Sea state), sparking clashes the following day. No injuries were reported. [size=no report]

Looting: On 23 May 2021, eight unknown gunmen intercepted a truck carrying food aid destined for South Sudan at the Shabarga area of Medani Al Kubra locality (Al Jazirah state), separating the truck from the rest of the convoy and stealing 30 sacks of food as well as fuel and a phone belonging to the driver.

On 21 May 2021, clashes were reported between armed pastoralists of the Misseriya and Hamar groups at or near Adila town (Ghubaish locality, West Kordofan state), killing 3 and wounding 5. The clashes are reported to be linked to the demarcation of territory.

On 21 May 2021, two unspecified clans clashed at Al-Duweikah in the area of El Mahfora (As Sunut locality, West Kordofan state), with three killed and five wounded. Authorities have intervened, and a reconciliation agreement was signed by the feuding groups.

On 20 May 2021, unknown attackers killed three IDP farmers near Kadbar (presumed to be an alternate spelling of Kedber) in Delami locality (South Kordofan state). Police have reportedly failed to investigate the killings. Note that one source says the killings took place in Abanga in the same area.

assoc_actor_2: Government of Sudan (2019-); JEM: Justice and Equality Movement
notes: On 20 May 2021, IDPs from Kalma IDP camp demonstrated against the arrival of the Minister for Social Development at Kalma IDP Camp (Beliel locality, South Darfur state), throwing stones at his convoy (wounding two people, and damaging several windows), and briefly prevented the Minister from leaving a health center at the camp. The unrest is likely to be connected to the Juba Peace Agreement, with residents of the camp opposing the agreement and the minister representing a faction (JEM) that signed it. [size=no report]
Around 20 May 2021 (as reported), demonstrators and activists gathered in Port Sudan (Port Sudan locality, Red Sea state), denouncing increasing bread prices. [size=no report]

On 19 May 2021, SAF and SAF Reservists clashed with Ethiopian militiamen (presumed to be Amhara) in an area described as being east of Sundus (Galabat Ash-Shargiah locality, Gedaref state) and east of Jabel Tayyara, reportedly seizing five settlements that had been occupied by Amhara forces since 1995. There is no information regarding casualties or fatalities.

On 19 May 2021, Masalit and Arab militias (the latter presumed to be members of the Rizeigat community) clashed in the areas of Tendelti and Geilo in north-west Ag Geneina locality (West Darfur state), killing 5 and wounding 8, and temporarily displacing approximately 1,850 people to Chad. 40 farms were also torched. The fighting began after a dispute between pastoralists and a family of farmers escalated.
Around 19 May 2021 (as reported), Amhara militiamen killed a Sudanese fisherman in the area of Mashra Al Fursan (Galabat Ash-Shargiah locality, Gedaref state), after a botched kidnapping attempt.

On 18 May 2021, around 160 security guards who were dismissed from employment with the World Food Programme in 2011 demonstrated in El Fasher (Al Fasher locality, North Darfur state), calling for compensation for their dismissal. The group began a sit-in protest, which has lasted for at least three days. [size=around 160]

On 18 May 2021, unknown gunmen fired upon a branch of the Bank of Khartoum in El Geneina city (Ag Geneina locality, West Darfur state), before fleeing in their vehicle. There is no clear motive for the attack, which comes amid continued tensions in and around the city.

On 18 May 2021, hundreds of demonstrators from Atbara arrived at Bahri train station in Khartoum North (Bahri locality, Khartoum state), demanding justice for the victims of those killed at events commemorating the Ramadan/June 3rd massacre. The demonstrators travelled to Kafuri and then on to the sit-in protest at a hospital in southern Khartoum. [size=hundreds]

Around 17 May 2021 (as reported), South Sudanese refugees clashed with local Sudanese at Al Nimir Refugee Camp (Al Firdous locality, East Darfur state), with several people reported wounded (note that it is not specified whether weapons were used). There is no further information. [size=no report]

On 17 May 2021, hundreds of demonstrators and civil society activists marched in Ed Damazin city (Ed Damazine locality, Blue Nile state), denouncing sexual violence, whilst calling for greater support for survivors of rape; more effective investigations; and an end to stigma surrounding rape. The demonstration follows a recent high-profile case of gang rape in nearby El Roseires. [size=hundreds]
Around 17 May 2021 (as reported), three children were killed and four wounded whilst playing with unexploded ordnance at Karam Allah (Abyei-Muglad locality, West Kordofan state) [coded to Muglad].

assoc_actor_2: Ngok Clan Group (Sudan); Dinka Ethnic Group (Sudan)
source: Radio Dabanga; UNISFA; Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Tamazuj
notes: On 16 May 2021, Misseriya militiamen attacked Dungop village in the contested Abyei PCA area, killing 11 Ngok Dinka civilians and wounding 5. There is no clear motivation for the attack, which follows a smaller attack west of Abyei town two days prior. Alternative accounts say up to 12 were killed and 7 wounded, and that Sudanese military forces were involved in the attack. One account suggests the victims were Ngok Dinka police officers rather than civilians.

On 16 May 2021, residents of Al Abbasiya town (Abassiya locality, South Kordofan state) demonstrated against insecurity in and around the town, and called for the local security committee to be dissolved. [size=no report]

On 14 May 2021, clashes between unspecified South Sudanese communities (some armed with bladed weapons) broke out in several parts of Greater Khartoum, seemingly concentrated in eastern areas of Hajj Yusuf (Sharg An Neel locality, Khartoum state) and Soba. 7 were killed and 22 wounded, with mass arrests of South Sudanese resulting in 600 being tried and sentenced for involvement (to be deported to South Sudan upon completion of their sentences), and 180 awaiting trial. The clashes relate to an elopement.

Around 14 May 2021 (as reported), demonstrators gathered at hospital in Nyala city (Nyala Janoub locality, South Darfur state), preventing the governor from accessing the hospital. The demonstrators expressed their anger at the death of 14 police in a botched operation in Al Radoum locality on 12 May, calling for an investigation into the events. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_2: Ngok Clan Group (Sudan); Dinka Ethnic Group (Sudan)
notes: On 14 May 2021, Misseriya militiamen killed two elderly Ngok Dinka civilians at an area west of Abyei town in the disputed Abyei PCA area. There is no clear motive for the killing. A local official has alleged that the Sudan Armed Forces were involved in the attack, although this is not corroborated elsewhere.

On 13 May 2021, four pastoralists belonging to the Rufaa ethnic group were killed at an unspecified location in Blue Nile state [coded to state capital Ed Damazin, Ed Damazine locality]. The Rufaa have accused SPLM-North rebels of the Abdelaziz el-Hilu faction of being responsible, but this is not corroborated by other sources. 1,400 head of sheep were also stolen in the attack.

On 13 May 2021, Hausa pastoralists clashed with an unspecified group from Blue Nile described as 'Funj' (but without stating the precise identity of the group to which the term is applied to) at Medina 11 in Geisan locality (Blue Nile state) [coded to Fazughli]. At least 2 were killed and several wounded during the clash, which was fought using bladed weapons. The clash was reportedly sparked by the theft of cattle by a member of the Hausa group.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Sudan (2019-) Rapid Support Forces
notes: On 13 May 2021, SAF clashed with an unidentified group at a market in El Geneina city (Ag Geneina locality, West Darfur state), in unclear circumstances. Four people were wounded, including two civilian bystanders. One of the wounded from the armed group was reported to be a member of the RSF.
On 12 May 2021, an unknown group (described as being militias loyal to the Bashir regime) fired two rockets into Kalma IDP Camp (Beliel locality, South Darfur state). No injuries were reported.

actor1: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
actor2: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction) (Splinter Faction)
notes: On 12 May 2021, two unspecified factions of the SLM/A Abdul Wahid al-Nur rebel group clashed at Fanga Suk (Shamal Jabal Marrah locality, Central Darfur state), in what is described as a dispute over access to land. 1,284 were displaced. There is no information regarding casualties or fatalities.

On 12 May 2021, thousands of demonstrators (including Resistance Committee members) gathered in Omdurman (Um Durman locality, Khartoum state) at the funeral of a man killed during demonstrations the previous day near the army HQ . The demonstrators were calling for justice for the victim, and denounced the failures of the committee tasked with investigating the June 3rd/Ramadan massacre in 2019. [size=thousands]

On 12 May 2021, police engaged in a series of clashes with what are described as drug traffickers in and around Songo town (Al Radoum locality, South Darfur state), resulting in 14 police being killed and around 14 being wounded (note that one report suggests a child was killed in the crossfire, though this is not confirmed). During the fighting, unarmed civilians reportedly accompanied the drug traffickers to act as human shields, and then organized a demonstration around the police after they retreated into Songo town, shortly before fighting resumed. The police were eventually evacuated by air.

source: VOA; Al Rakoba; Twitter; Sudan Tribune; Radio Dabanga; Sudan News Agency
notes: On 11 May 2021, thousands of demonstrators (including Resistance Committee members) blocked roads with burning tires and rocks at several location in Khartoum (Khartoum state), and marched to the site of the June 3rd/Ramadan massacre at the army HQ. SAF personnel opened fire using live rounds, tear gas, and stun grenades, with some demonstrators throwing rocks at the soldiers. 2 demonstrators were killed and 37 wounded; authorities claim to have arrested the soldiers who fired upon the demonstrators. Demonstrators subsequently gathered at the Royal Care Hospital in southern Khartoum, where one of the victims later died, and began a sit-in demonstration which lasted until late May. [size=thousands]

On 11 May 2021, demonstrators gathered in Omdurman (Um Durman locality, Khartoum state) to commemorate the anniversary of the June 3rd/Ramadan massacre. The demonstrators blocked roads with burning tires. [size=no report]

On 11 May 2021, demonstrators gathered in Wad Medani (Medani Al Kubra locality, Al Jazirah state) to commemorate the anniversary of the June 3rd/Ramadan massacre, blocking the roads with rocks. [size=no report]

On 11 May 2021, demonstrators gathered in Khartoum North (Bahri locality, Khartoum state) to commemorate the anniversary of the June 3rd/Ramadan massacre. The demonstrators blocked roads with burning tires. [size=no report]
On 11 May 2021, demonstrators gathered in Kassala (Madeinat Kassala locality, Kassala state) to commemorate the anniversary of the June 3rd/Ramadan massacre. [size=no report]

On 11 May 2021, demonstrators gathered in Gedaref (Madeinat Al Gedaref locality, Al Jazirah state) to commemorate the anniversary of the June 3rd/Ramadan massacre, blocking the roads with burning tires. [size=no report]

On 11 May 2021, demonstrators (including Resistance Committee members) gathered in Nyala (Nyala Janoub locality, South Darfur state) to commemorate the anniversary of the June 3rd/Ramadan massacre. [size=no report]

actor1: Military Forces of Sudan (2019-) Military Intelligence Service
notes: Weapons seizure: Around 10 May 2021 (as reported), SAF Military Intelligence intercepted a convoy carrying 17,500 rounds of ammunition, 500 firearms, and a stash of narcotics on the main road running through Al Qureisha locality (Gedaref state) [coded to Qureisha]. The weapons were reportedly intended for use by Ethiopian militias in the disputed border area. Three of the smugglers were arrested, though the nationality of the smugglers is unspecified (and is presumed here to be Ethiopian).

On 10 May 2021, unknown gunmen (described as 'outlaws' in one account, and as mounted militiamen in another) fired upon the vehicle carrying the Executive Director of West Jebel Marra locality in the Wadi Melgu area to the west of Nertiti (Gharb Jabal Marrah locality, Central Darfur state) [coded to Khor Ramla]. The victim died later of his wounds whilst in hospital.

On 10 May 2021, relatives of army officers who were executed by the Bashir regime in 1990 gathered in Khartoum (Khartoum state), demanding justice, and calling for the location of their grave site to be disclosed. [size=no report]
On 10 May 2021, dock workers demonstrated at the Central Bank branch in Port Sudan (Port Sudan locality, Red Sea state), after their newly increased salaries went unpaid. [size=no report]

On 9 May 2021, members of the disbanded Popular Defence Forces robbed a passenger vehicle near Kologi (Ghadeer locality, South Kordofan state), shooting and wounding one of the passengers in the process. The attack follows a previous robbery by PDF militiamen in the same area on 6 May.

On 9 May 2021, residents of Abu Zerega (Dar As Salam locality, North Darfur state) blocked the main road running through the town (through unspecified means) in protest at ongoing water and electricity shortages. [size=no report]

On 9 May 2021, residents of El Tomat suburb in Dilling town (Dilling locality, South Kordofan state) blocked the main road to Kadugli using burning tires and rocks. The demonstrators were denouncing ongoing water and electricity shortages, and soaring transportation costs. [size=no report]

On 8 May 2021, armed pastoralists attacked farms in the area of Birkat Seira (Saraf Omra locality, North Darfur state), looting goods and property. A farmer with a firearm discharged his weapon into the air, causing the attackers to flee.

Around 6 May 2021 (as reported), a member of an unspecified Rizeigat clan was killed by a member of a different clan in the Misteriya area of Kebkabiya locality (North Darfur state). There is a reported mobilization from both sides following the killing.

On 6 May 2021, two groups armed with bladed weapons (presumed to be Beja) clashed in Suakin port (Sawakin locality, Red Sea state) after a verbal dispute escalated, causing several injuries. There is no further information at this time.

On 6 May 2021, Amhara militia abducted a Sudanese farmer at Mashra Al Fursan (Galabat Ash-Shargiah locality, Gedaref state), demanding a 5 million SSP ransom. The abduction is the latest in a spate of abductions in recent months, amid ongoing hosting hostilities in the disputed border territory.
On 6 May 2021, armed pastoralists killed a male IDP at Khor Jagedeldei (Kutum locality, North Darfur state), before fleeing from the area. There is no clear motive for the killing.

actor1: Military Forces of Sudan (2019-) Rapid Support Forces
notes: On 6 May 2021, RSF paramilitaries operating under the Peace Shield Forces once again clashed with militiamen inside of Saraf Omra town (Saraf Omra locality, North Darfur state), with 5 RSF sustaining wounds. 7 of the militia were arrested, and 81 motorbikes reportedly seized.

source: Sudan Tribune; Al Rakoba; Radio Dabanga
notes: On 5 May 2021, demonstrators (including Resistance Committee members) clashed with police (possibly operating in conjunction with additional security forces) at El Udayyah town (Al Idia locality, West Kordofan state), after the demonstrators - who have been staging a sit-in demonstration for several months - reportedly threw stones at a local official. One demonstrator was killed during the clashes, which involved the use of tear gas and live rounds. At least seven were injured, including some police. Government buildings were burned and vehicles damaged. [size=no report]

On 5 May 2021, SAF and SAF Reservists clashed with unspecified Ethiopian militiamen (presumed to be Amhara, and coded as such) in the Shy Biet area of Basundah locality (Gedaref state, approximate coordinates for Shy Biet used at GP2). Sudanese forces seized the area, expelling the Ethiopian militia (one report says both soldiers and militia were expelled) as well as farmers, before setting up a base camp at Al Hujairat. There is no information regarding casualties or fatalities.

On 5 May 2021, staff at the Khartoum Teaching Hospital (Khartoum state) and Resistance Committee members began a sit-in demonstration at the hospital, calling for the dismissal of the hospital director after four staff members critical of the director were removed from their positions. [size=no report]

On 5 May 2021, Resistance Committee members demonstrated in Al Jarif East (Sharg An Neel locality, Khartoum state), after a member of the Resistance Committee had been missing without explanation for one month. The demonstrators denounced the failure of authorities to investigate the disappearance. [size=no report]

actor1: Military Forces of Sudan (2019-) Rapid Support Forces
notes: On 4 May 2021, RSF paramilitaries clashed with a militia riding motorbikes in the area of Saraf Omra town (Saraf Omra locality, North Darfur state), with a child reportedly killed in the crossfire. There do not appear to have been any injuries or fatalities to either of the belligerents, although RSF vehicles were damaged and several motorbikes confiscated by the RSF.

On 4 May 2021, citizens from the Kalma area of Darfur (including IDPs) marched in Khartoum (Khartoum state), denouncing attacks against Kalma IDP camp and alleged plans to close the camp; for the governor to be dismissed and disarmament of the area; and for justice for those killed, injured and detained as a result of the violence. [size=no report]

actor1: Military Forces of Sudan (2019-) Military Intelligence Service
notes: Around 3 May 2021 (as reported), SAF soldiers (implied to be from Military Intelligence, and coded as such) tortured three South Sudanese refugees in El Fasher city (Al Fasher locality, North Darfur state), who were detained following the murder of a soldier in a neighborhood close their district. One of the refugees died as a result of the torture.

actor1: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Amhara Regional Special Forces
assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Ethiopia (2018-); Amhara Ethnic Militia (Ethiopia)
notes: Movement of forces: Around 3 May 2021 (as reported), an increased presence and activity of Ethiopian forces (provisionally coded as Amhara Liyu police, ENDF, and Amhara militias) has been reported in disputed areas of Al Qureisha and Al Fashaga localities (Gedaref state), including the areas of Barakat Norein, Surafah, Gemmayzeh, Hillat Khater, Al Kurdiya forest and Camp Yamani.

Around 3 May 2021 (as reported), police dispersed a sit-in protest at the Civil Aviation Authority in Khartoum (Khartoum state), firing tear gas at the workers who had been demonstrating for a month in front of the offices of the Authority. The workers were calling for the dismissal of the director of the institution. [size=no report]

Around 3 May 2021 (as reported), former workers at the Presidential Palace in Khartoum (Khartoum state) demonstrated at their former place of employment, demanding to be reinstated and to receive financial compensation for their dismissal. [size=no report]

On 3 May 2021, unknown gunmen attacked farmers at the Wadi Bargo area near Birkat Seira (Saraf Omra locality, North Darfur state), beating and shooting six of the farmers before robbing them. Several are said to be seriously wounded, though no fatalities have been reported.

On 2 May 2021, armed pastoralists beat an unspecified number of female farmers who were gathering firewood in the Serri area (presumed to be an alternate spelling of Serreih) in Kutum locality (North Darfur state).

On 2 May 2021, demonstrators gathered in western parts of Kassala city (Madeinat Kassala locality, Kassala state) after a child was wounded during a police operation against the illicit sale of fuel. Police dispersed demonstrators with tear gas and live rounds (presumed to have been fired into the air). [size=no report]

On 30 April 2021, residents of El Koaik (Ar Reif Ash Shargi locality, South Kordofan state) blocked the main road (through unspecified means) running through the town, denouncing the killing of a man by unknown attackers earlier that day. [size=no report]
On 30 April 2021, unknown gunmen killed a man and stole his cattle at a forested area near El Koaik (Ar Reif Ash Shargi locality, South Kordofan state). There is no further information.

actor1: Military Forces of Sudan (2019-) Military Intelligence Service
assoc_actor_2: Former Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019); Prisoners (Sudan)
notes: On 30 April 2021, an activist (who is also a retired police officer) was severely beaten in the custody of SAF Military Intelligence in El Obeid (Sheikan locality, North Kordofan state), following an altercation at a petrol station. The victim was kicked until he became unconscious, and threats were made against his life. His wallet and phone were also stolen.

Around 29 April 2021 (as reported), medical students demonstrated at the local Ministry of Education in El Geneina city (Ag Geneina locality, West Darfur state), demanding they be transferred to other universities in the country following the intensive violence in the city in recent months. The students prevented employees of the Ministry from leaving their building for seven hours, with police eventually intervening to allow the staff to leave. [size=no report]

Other: On 29 April 2021, Minni Minawi Arko - who leads one of the two main factions of the SLM/A rebellion (and was the only one of these factions to sign the Juba Peace Agreement) - was appointed Governor of Darfur. The precise powers of the Governor have not been defined, nor have the existing five states of Darfur been merged into a single administrative system. The development is likely to raise tensions in parts of Darfur, and further strain protracted peace talks with Minawi's rival Abdul Wahid el Nur, who commands the more militarily significant faction of the SLM/A based in Jebel Marra. Event coded to Khartoum (Khartoum state).

On 29 April 2021, residents of As Salam locality demonstrated at the Governor's residence in Nyala city (Nyala Janoub locality, South Darfur state), calling for the perpetrators of the attacks in the Bulbul area to be brought to justice, and for the rule of law to be enforced. [size=no report]

On 29 April 2021, students from the Education Faculty at the college in Gebeit blocked the highway to Khartoum (using unspecified means) at Sinkat town (Sinkat locality, Red Sea state), denouncing the deteriorating quality of their educational experience. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Sudan (2019-); Military Forces of Sudan (2019-) Abu Tira; Military Forces of Sudan (2019-) Rapid Support Forces
notes: On 28 April 2021, a combined force of police, soldiers, Central Reserve Police/Abu Tira, and RSF violently dispersed the Resistance Committee-organized sit-in protest in Bielel town (Beliel locality, South Darfur state), killing one and wounding 8. Security services fired tear gas and live rounds, and arrested six Resistance Committee members. [size=no report]

On 28 April 2021, clashes between two unspecified ethnic groups took place in the El Hamid/Al Humaid area of Ghadeer locality (South Kordofan state) [coded to Gadier], killing 'a large number' across five days of fighting and wounding an unspecified number. 10 fatalities coded across five events. An unspecified third force joined the fighting, of which there is no further detail at this time.

On 28 April 2021, an unknown group (coded as South Kordofan communal militia) attacked Kedber (Delami locality, South Kordofan state), killing one person and wounding another. An unspecified number of cattle were stolen in the attack.

actor1: UNISFA: United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (2011-)
assoc_actor_1: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
notes: Other: Around 28 April 2021 (as reported), around 100 ENDF soldiers of Tigrayan ethnicity were reported to have left the UNISFA peacekeeping force based in the Abyei PCA area, and sought asylum in Sudan. The soldiers are reported to now be in El Fasher in North Darfur. UPDATE: On May 6, information emerged suggesting that 119 Tigrayan ENDF soldiers serving with the (departing) UNAMID mission in Darfur have also requested asylum.

Around 27 April 2021 (as reported), farmers from north-eastern areas of Blue Nile state demonstrated in the state capital of Ed Damazin (Ed Damazine locality, Blue Nile state), calling for the boundary between farming areas in the state and the Dindir national park to revert to a previous delineation; for land to be returned to them; and for wildlife officers to respect these boundaries. [size=no report]

On 27 April 2021, clashes between two unspecified ethnic groups took place in the El Hamid/Al Humaid area of Ghadeer locality (South Kordofan state) [coded to Gadier], killing 'a large number' across five days of fighting and wounding an unspecified number. 10 fatalities coded across five events. An unspecified third force joined the fighting, of which there is no further detail at this time.

Around 26 April 2021 (as reported), staff working for the national television channels demonstrated at the Broadcasting Commission in Omdurman (Um Durman locality, Khartoum state), calling for their employment status to be regularized. [size=no report]

On 26 April 2021, clashes between two unspecified ethnic groups took place in the El Hamid/Al Humaid area of Ghadeer locality (South Kordofan state) [coded to Gadier], killing 'a large number' across five days of fighting and wounding an unspecified number. 10 fatalities coded across five events. An unspecified third force joined the fighting, of which there is no further detail at this time.

On 25 April 2021, a sit-in demonstration (involving Resistance Committee members) began in Bielel town (Beliel locality, South Darfur state), calling for improvements in employment opportunities; the provision of essential goods; and for functioning police, health and education services. [size=no report]

On 25 April 2021, hospital guards (coded as Private Security) and police attempted to disperse a sit-demonstration in Khartoum (Khartoum state) which related to the failure of hospital authorities to adequately preserve dead bodies in a hospital morgue. 2 were seriously injured (through unspecified means) as a result of the intervention. One source indicates an unspecified Islamist group was involved in planning the dispersal, but does not elaborate on details. [size=no report]

On 25 April 2021, clashes between two unspecified ethnic groups took place in the El Hamid/Al Humaid area of Ghadeer locality (South Kordofan state) [coded to Gadier], killing 'a large number' across five days of fighting and wounding an unspecified number. 10 fatalities coded across five events. An unspecified third force joined the fighting, of which there is no further detail at this time.

On 25 April 2021, 8 armed men attacked Sabat in Delami locality (South Kordofan state) [coded to Dalami] in what appears to have been a botched cattle raid. Militia from the camp clashed with the raiders, with the raiders killing one of the militia before fleeing from the area.
On 25 April 2021, dozens of residents of El Obeid (Sheikan locality, North Kordofan state) began a sit-in protest in response to severe shortages of drinking water. [size=dozens]

On 24 April 2021, residents of Kelemando locality (North Darfur state) began a sit-in protest at an unspecified location [coded to Wadaah] in response to ongoing shortages of drinking water. The demonstrators also called for the improvement of health and education services. [size=no report]

On 24 April 2021, clashes between two unspecified ethnic groups took place in the El Hamid/Al Humaid area of Ghadeer locality (South Kordofan state) [coded to Gadier], killing 'a large number' across five days of fighting and wounding an unspecified number. 10 fatalities coded across five events. An unspecified third force joined the fighting, of which there is no further detail at this time.

Around 24 April 2021 (as reported), residents of As Salam locality demonstrated in Nyala city (Nyala Janoub locality, South Darfur state), denouncing the failure of state security organs to uphold security following a recent attack in the locality. [size=no report]

Around 24 April 2021 (as reported), SAF clashed with an unknown armed group riding in five vehicles at the High Dam area south of El Geneina city (Ag Geneina locality, West Darfur state) [coded to Randi], resulting in 3 SAF soldiers being wounded. The circumstances of the clashes are disputed.

Around 24 April 2021 (as reported), militias on horseback and motorbike (coded as a Darfur pastoralist militia) attacked the village of Gassat Enjemet and several nearby villages, all of which are described as being in the Bulbul area (As Salam locality, South Darfur state). 3 or 4 people were killed (one of whom died later of their wounds) and at least 4 injured, and an unspecified number of people were displaced from the area. One source says the attack followed after a clash with SLM-Transitional Council forces, although this is not corroborated elsewhere.

On 23 April 2021, a group of armed men (who included four 'regular forces' (presumed to be SAF)) beat a surgeon and two nurses at the hospital in Nyala city (Nyala Janoub locality, South Darfur state). Several were arrested, and doctors in the city went on strike following the attack.

On 21 April 2021, Resistance Committee members demonstrated in Atbara city (Atbara locality, River Nile state) to coincide with the visit of PM Hamdock to the city, burning tires in the road to the airport. The demonstrators were denouncing the continued deterioration in economic conditions and living standards, as well as the failure to establish the Legislative Council which had been agreed to in 2019. [size=no report]

On 20 April 2021, demonstrators began a sit-in protest in Berber town (Barbar locality, River Nile state). The demonstrators demanded the dismissal of the locality director and the economic committee or River Nile state. [size=no report]
Around 20 April 2021, demonstrators gathered once again in El Obeid city (Sheikan locality, North Kordofan state), protesting against the lack of water in the city. [size=no report]

On 19 April 2021, police officers continued to demonstrate in Nertiti town (Gharb Jabal Marrah locality, Central Darfur state) against the non-payment of salaries. The officers - who were inside the police compound - fired weapons into the air to prevent the local police director from entering the premises. [size=no report]
Around 19 April 2021, demonstrators gathered in El Obeid city (Sheikan locality, North Kordofan state), protesting against the lack of water in the city. [size=no report]

On 18 April 2021, clashes broke out in Al Abbasiya town (Abassiya locality, South Kordofan state) between a communal militia (comprising local residents) and an armed group who have been engaged in criminal activity in the town. 4 were killed and 18 injured, some seriously.
On 18 April 2021, police officers demonstrated in Nertiti town (Gharb Jabal Marrah locality, Central Darfur state) against the non-payment of salaries. [size=no report]

On 18 April 2021, demonstrators began a sit-in protest at a hospital in Khartoum (Khartoum state), denouncing the failure of hospital authorities to adequately preserve dead bodies in the morgue, some of whom are likely among those reported missing in the June 3rd massacre. Demonstrators called for the dismissal of the Director of Forensic Medicine, and for justice for the victims of the massacre. [size=no report]

On 18 April 2021, demonstrators blocked the main road (through unspecified means) between Kosti and Khartoum at an unspecified location in White Nile state (presumed to be close to Rabak town, given its proximity to Asalaya), denouncing the fighting that took place in Asalaya the previous day. The specific grievances of the demonstrators is not stated. [size=no report]

On 17 April 2021, police clashed with armed pastoralists in the Heglig area in the vicinity of Asalaya town (Rabak locality, White Nile state), after police confiscated their livestock. 3 were killed, including 1 police officer.

Around 15 April 2021 (month of), a young IDP with special educational needs was shot eight times by unknown gunmen in El Salaam IDP Camp (Beliel locality, South Darfur state), immediately killing the victim. The attackers then graffitied on his body. There is no clear motive for the attack.

Around 15 April 2021 (month of), South Sudanese refugees rioted at Al Redis 2 Refugee Camp (As Salam/Ar Rawat locality, White Nile state), in unclear circumstances. During two days of riots, the police station was torched, and Red Crescent buildings were also attacked. At least two people were arrested. [size=no report]

On 15 April 2021, demonstrators (including Resistance Committee members) blocked the highway using burning tires at an unspecified location in Berber locality (Barbar locality, River Nile state). The demonstrators demanded the dismissal of the locality director and the economic committee or River Nile state, and for functioning electricity and water in the area. [size=no report]

On 14 April 2021, Amhara militiamen abducted four Sudanese children from the Atrab area (Basundah locality, Gedaref state), reportedly for ransom. The abduction comes among ongoing tensions in the disputed area.

source: Al Rakoba; All Africa; Al Sudani; Radio Dabanga; Ayin Network; Sudan Tribune
notes: On 12 April 2021, armed militias wearing military uniforms close to Gereida (Gereida, West Darfur) attacked a vehicle. Seven civilians were killed and three wounded.

On 11 April 2021, SAF and SAF Reservists clashed with an armed group (presumed to be Ethiopian) smuggling weapons in Um Tawakkul (Galabat Ash-Shargiah, Gedaref). One smuggler was arrested. The group tried to smuggle large quantities of weapons, ammunition and explosives to Ethiopian militias. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

source: All Africa; Al Rakoba; Radio Dabanga
notes: On 11 April 2021, a group of people in Buram (Buram, South Darfur) gathered in front of the Council of Ministers for the third consecutive week demanding security and services related to health services, electricity and water. The group also protested against mining conditions and the use of toxic materials in mining. [size=no report]

source: Sudan Tribune; Radio Dabanga; Darfur 24; All Africa; Alnilin; Alintibaha; Al Rakoba
notes: On 11 April 2021, students in El Fasher (Al Fasher, North Darfur) demonstrated against poor living conditions and continuous interruption of electricity and water. Rioters blocked main roads and set fire to tires. Police dispersed rioters with tear gas and live bullets. Students invaded the governor's house, injured six members of the armed forces. One student was shot and two injured. There were demonstrations also in Ondurman, Nyala and Khartoum. [size=no report]

On 9 April 2021, youth from Dalami town (coded as South Kordofan militia) attacked an unspecified pastoralist camp north of Dalami town (Dalami locality, South Kordofan state) [coded to Mabroka], killing one pastoralist and torching several dwellings. The source suggests the youth were taking revenge for two incidents in which farmers were killed earlier that day.
On 9 April 2021, unidentified gunmen killed a farmer in Habila (Habila-SK, South Kordofan).

source: Sudan Tribune; Radio Dabanga; Al Sudani; Akhbar al Yawm
notes: On 9 April 2021, a group of women gathered in Khartoum (Khartoum, Khartoum) to demand the abolition of laws that discriminate on the basis of gender. A driver assaulted the protesters, leaving one injured. [size=no report]

On 8 April 2021, hundreds of women marched in Khartoum (Khartoum state), calling for the abolition of discriminatory laws; greater progress at combating political exclusion and ensuring safety of women and girls; for Sudanese authorities to sign international charters on equal rights for women; and for special courts to be established to handle cases of gender-based violence. During the demonstration, a vehicle intentionally ran over a protester (who survived, but was injured), before its occupant 'physically and verbally assaulted' protesters, before being apprehended by police. [size=hundreds]

On 8 April 2021, hundreds of protesters gathered at the main UN offices in Khartoum (Khartoum state), calling for protection for civilians and the displaced in West Darfur, and for the removal of RSF paramilitaries from the state, following series violence in El Geniena in recent days. [size=hundreds]
On 8 April 2021, unknown gunmen killed a male IDP in the area of Salma (Kreinik locality, West Darfur state). There is no further information.
On 8 April 2021, a group of people in Nyala (Nyala Janoub, South Darfur) gathered to demonstrate against the continuous interruption of electricity. [size=no report]

On 8 April 2021, Resistance Committees representing workers from the central bus terminal in Khartoum (Khartoum state) began a sit-in protest at the station, calling for the removal of several officials who have been accused of corruption. Police dispersed the demonstrators, and arrested four. [size=no report]

On 7 April 2021, demonstrators gathered in the city of Wad Medani (Greater Wad Madani locality, El Gazira state) in commemoration of the second anniversary of the sit-in protest outside the army HQ, and called for a correction in the course of the revolution, and for justice for those who died during the uprising. [size=no report]

On 7 April 2021, demonstrators gathered in the city of Gedaref (Gedaref locality, Gedaref state) in commemoration of the second anniversary of the sit-in protest outside the army HQ, and called for a correction in the course of the revolution, and for justice for those who died during the uprising. [size=no report]

On 7 April 2021, demonstrators gathered in Khartoum (Khartoum state) in commemoration of the second anniversary of the sit-in outside the army HQ, and called for a correction in the course of the revolution, and for justice for those who died during the uprising. Police fired tear gas (wounding one person, who was hit by a cannister), whilst demonstrators and police clashed. Demonstrators also blocked roads, though through unspecified means. [size=no report]

On 7 April 2021, demonstrators gathered in the city of Kassala (Kassala locality, Kassala state) in commemoration of the second anniversary of the sit-in protest outside the army HQ, and called for a correction in the course of the revolution, and for justice for those who died during the uprising. [size=no report]

On 7 April 2021, demonstrators (including Resistance Committee members) gathered at the Gum Arabic Forum event in El Obeid (Shiekan locality, North Kordofan state) where PM Hamdock was present. The demonstrators protested against the governor of the state, calling for his dismissal. [size=no report]

On 7 April 2021, demonstrators gathered in the city of Port Sudan (Port Sudan locality, Red Sea state) in commemoration of the second anniversary of the sit-in protest outside the army HQ. Some demonstrators called for a correction in the course of the revolution; others called for workers removed by the anti-corruption committee to be reinstated, and for improvements to water provision; the removal of the governor; and for the Forces for Freedom and Change to be restructured. [size=no report]

On 7 April 2021, demonstrators gathered in Atbara town (Atbara locality, River Nile state) in commemoration of the second anniversary of the sit-in protest outside the army HQ, and called for a correction in the course of the revolution, and for justice for those who died during the uprising. The demonstrators also called for the Forces for Freedom and Change to undertake reforms. [size=no report]

On 7 April 2021, four gunmen intercepted a group returning from Donkey Abiad to Gereida town (Gereida locality, South Darfur state) after gathering firewood. A police officer accompanying the group resisted their attempts to loot from him, and was shot and wounded in the stomach. The rest of the group appear to have been robbed.

On 7 April 2021, demonstrators gathered at Dibebad (Al Qoz locality, South Kordofan state) and blocked a road (through unspecified means), during the inauguration of the South Kordofan Security and Peace Conference. The demonstrators were contesting their exclusion from the conference, and denounced the governor of the state. Police fired tear gas at the demonstrators (wounding one) and made three arrests. [size=no report]
On 7 April 2021, a group of people in Nyala (Nyala Janoub, South Darfur) gathered to demonstrate against the continuous interruption of electricity. [size=no report]

On 7 April 2021, a vehicle carrying a local official was fired upon by SAF at the Romantas area at an unspecified location along the Central-West Darfur border [coded to Deirirro, Azum locality, Central Darfur state], after they failed to stop at a checkpoint. The official was killed and the two other passengers in the vehicle were wounded, whilst SAF soldiers sustained four injuries when one of the passengers fired upon them.

Around 7 April 2021 (as reported), protesters began a sit-in demonstration in Yassin town (Yassin locality, East Darfur state), in response to the lack of water in and around the city. Authorities have acknowledged the problem is serious, and attribute the shortages to a lack of fuel, which has prevented the operation of water pumps. [size=no report]

On 6 April 2021, members of the El Gazira and El Manageel Farmer's Alliance demonstrated in Wad Medani (Greater Wad Madani locality, El Gazira state), calling for the reversal of a 2005 law regulating agriculture and the rearing of animals; for authorities to take additional measures to combat losses of water; and highlighting the effects of high fuel prices for agricultural production. [size=no report]
On 6 April 2021, demonstrators gathered in Khartoum (Khartoum state) to denounce the ongoing violence in El Geniena city. [size=no report]

source: VOA; UN OHCHR; Radio Dabanga; Sudan Tribune
notes: On 6 April 2021, parts of Abu Zar IDP Camp (adjacent to El Geneina) were torched and looted amid heavy fighting between Masalit and Rizeigat militias (the latter reportedly backed by gunmen from Chad) in El Geneina (Ag Geneina locality, West Darfur state). At least four days of fighting has killed at least 147 (a figure presumed to include the two Masalit civilians killed on 3 April, which are coded separately) and wounded at least 233 (dozens seriously) (145 fatalities distributed evenly across four events). RSF paramilitaries have been accused of involvement on the side of the Rizeigat, although this is disputed by authorities. An unspecified number have been displaced, with over a thousand displaced to Chad. Reports indicate that Rizeigat and Masalit militias from outside of El Geneina arrived in the city to assist their kin.

On 6 April 2021, SAF and SAF Reservists clashed with Amhara militia and unspecified 'other forces' in Mashra in Basundah locality (Gedaref state) [coded to Mashra Tuklayn; note that there are two locations that begin with Mashra in the same area]. The Ethiopian forces were reportedly taking farmers to the area to prepare for the upcoming rainy season. SAF claimed to have expelled the militia and torched the area being farmed; there is no information regarding casualties or fatalities.
On 6 April 2021, a group of unidentified armed men killed a farmer (who is described as being Nuba) at Miri forest near Kadugli (Kadugli locality, South Kordofan state) [coded to Miri Bara].

source: Al Rakoba; VOA; Sudan Tribune; Radio Dabanga; ACJPS; UN OHCHR
notes: On 5 April 2021, heavy fighting continued between Masalit and Rizeigat militias (the latter reportedly backed by gunmen from Chad) in El Geneina city (Ag Geneina locality, West Darfur state), with a power station reported to have been destroyed. The house of a local official was targeted during fighting, prompting an exchange of fire between the bodyguards of the official and the unidentified militia. At least four days of fighting has killed at least 147 (a figure presumed to include the two Masalit civilians killed on 3 April, which are coded separately) and wounded at least 233 (dozens seriously) (145 fatalities distributed evenly across four events). RSF paramilitaries have been accused of involvement on the side of the Rizeigat, although this is disputed by authorities. An unspecified number have been displaced, with over a thousand displaced to Chad. Reports indicate that Rizeigat and Masalit militias from outside of El Geneina arrived in the city to assist their kin.

On 5 April 2021, patients with kidney conditions blocked the road at El Managil (El Manageel locality, El Gazira state) with rocks, to denounce the lack of water in the city, which is preventing dialysis machines from working. [size=no report]

actor2: Military Forces of Sudan (2019-) Rapid Support Forces
notes: On 5 April 2021, RSF paramilitaries came under fire from an unspecified group who reportedly signed the Juba Peace Agreement, at an RSF installation at an unspecified location west of El Geneina city (West Darfur state) [coded to Dumej, El Geneina locality]. Five RSF were wounded, including a senior commander.

On 5 April 2021, a group of farmers gathered to demonstrate in Bara (Um Rawaba, North Kordofan) against a lack of water and to demand the provision of fuel to their farms. A farmer complained that that they received the last share of subsidized fuel last March. A 7 day sit-in followed. [size=no report]

On 4 April 2021, activists and members of the Martyrs' Families Organization gathered at the Ministry of Justice in Khartoum (Khartoum state), calling for Sudan to ratify the Rome Statute and transfer suspected war criminals to the International Criminal Court. The protesters also called for an end to impunity in Sudan, and for improvements in security in the country. [size=no report]

source: UN OHCHR; Sudan Tribune; ACJPS; VOA; Alintibaha; Radio Dabanga
notes: On 4 April 2021, heavy fighting continued between Masalit and Rizeigat militias (the latter reportedly backed by gunmen from Chad) in El Geneina city (Ag Geneina locality, West Darfur state), following an attack on Masalit civilians on 3 April. Medical workers were also fired upon and beaten by an unspecified group during the fighting. At least four days of fighting has killed at least 147 (a figure presumed to include the two Masalit civilians killed on 3 April, which are coded separately) and wounded at least 233 (dozens seriously) (145 fatalities distributed evenly across four events). RSF paramilitaries have been accused of involvement on the side of the Rizeigat, although this is disputed by authorities. An unspecified number have been displaced, with over a thousand displaced to Chad. Reports indicate that Rizeigat and Masalit militias from outside of El Geneina arrived in the city to assist their kin.

source: Radio Dabanga; Sudan Tribune; ACJPS; VOA; UN OHCHR
notes: On 3 April 2021, two Masalit civilian were killed and one wounded when militia (presumed to be Rizeigat) opened fire upon their vehicle in El Geniena city (El Geneina locality, West Darfur state). There is no clear motive for the killings.

On 3 April 2021, a Resistance Committee activist was taken from a sit-in demonstration at the hospital in Khartoum (Khartoum state) by an unknown group, with his body returned to the hospital the following day. The victim had been beaten to death. [size=no report]

source: ACJPS; Sudan Tribune; UN OHCHR; VOA; Radio Dabanga
notes: On 3 April 2021, heavy fighting erupted between Masalit and Rizeigat militias (the latter reportedly backed by gunmen from Chad) in El Geneina city (Ag Geneina locality, West Darfur state), following an attack on Masalit civilians earlier that day. At least four days of fighting has killed at least 147 (a figure presumed to include the two Masalit civilians killed on 3 April, which are coded separately) and wounded at least 233 (dozens seriously) (145 fatalities distributed evenly across four events). RSF paramilitaries have been accused of involvement on the side of the Rizeigat, although this is disputed by authorities. An unspecified number have been displaced, with over a thousand displaced to Chad. Reports indicate that Rizeigat and Masalit militias from outside of El Geneina arrived in the city to assist their kin.

Around 2 April 2021 (as reported), a Sudanese shepherd from the Al Lahuin ethnic group was killed and two others were wounded when they triggered an explosive device at Umm Adara in El Quresha locality (Gedaref state), described as being close to the international boundary [coded to Safarah]. It is not specified whether the device was unexploded ordnance or a landmine.

On 2 April 2021, fighting between factions of the Bani Hussein continued in or around El Serief Beni Hussein town (El Sireaf locality, North Darfur state), with three villages near the town reportedly torched. At least 5 were killed in the second day of clashes, and at least 30 wounded across both days.

Around 1 April 2021 (as reported), police and demonstrators clashed at the main bridge in Kassala city (Kassala locality, Kassala state), with police firing tear gas. The cause of the demonstration is not specified. [size=no report]

On 1 April 2021, demonstrations took place in Khartoum (Khartoum state), involving citizens originally from Buram in South Darfur. The demonstrators denounced the forceful dispersal of the sit-in protest at Buram the previous day. [size=no report]

On 1 April 2021, unspecified Ethiopian militiamen (coded as Amhara militia) attacked two Sudanese customs officers (coded as police) at or near Gallabat town (Basundah locality, Gedaref state). It is not clear what means were used to attacked the officers, nor whether the officers were injured. Sudanese officials closed the border at Gallabat two days later in response.

On 1 April 2021, 'human traffickers' from an unspecified nationality (provisionally coded as Ethiopian) fired upon a Gedaref state Ministry of Education vehicle at an unspecified location in Eastern El Galabat locality (Gedaref state) [coded to Elkfay], and clashed with police who were accompanying the convoy, causing minor injuries.

Around 1 April 2021 (week of), workers from the Civil Aviation Authority demonstrated in the front of the offices of the Authority in Khartoum (Khartoum state), calling for the removal of the director of the Authority (for reasons which are unspecified in the source). [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Sudan (2019-) Rapid Support Forces
notes: On 1 April 2021, fighting broke out between factions of the Bani Hussein at El Serief Beni Hussein town (El Sireaf locality, North Darfur state), in what is described as a dispute between elders over the appointment of the head of the tribe by a former military governor. The first shot was reportedly fired by an RSF captain, although it is unclear which faction he is linked to. At least 10 were killed in the first day of fighting, and at least 30 wounded across two days of clashes.

On 31 March 2021, workers at the National Laboratories gathered in Khartoum (Khartoum state), calling for their striking colleagues to resume work, and praising the director of the institution. [size=no report]

On 31 March 2021, police forcefully broke up a sit-in protest at Buram town (Buram locality, South Darfur state), calling for improvements to health care and infrastructure in the area, reportedly using tear gas to disperse crowds. [size=no report]

On 30 March 2021, demonstrators from the Benishangul-Gumuz region of Ethiopia demonstrated in Khartoum (Khartoum state), delivering a memorandum to the US Embassy. The demonstrators called for an end to atrocities and land-grabbing (which the demonstrators attributed to the Amhara), and called for an end to the killing of Gumuz people (presumed to be among the demonstrators) in Metekel zone. [size=no report]

Around 30 March 2021, demonstrators from North Kordofan state began a sit-in demonstration in Khartoum (Khartoum state), calling for the removal of the governor of North Kordofan over allegations of corruption, as well deteriorating services in the city. [size=no report]

On 30 March 2021, teachers from El Fasher University demonstrated at the campus in El Fasher city (El Fasher locality, North Darfur state), calling for the planned allocation of parts of the former UNAMID compound to the University to go ahead, and at greater speed. [size=no report]

On 30 March 2021, Beja youth began a sit-in demonstration (which lasted at least 3 days) at the Tax Bureau in Port Sudan (Port Sudan locality, Red Sea state), calling for the dismissal of the director of the office, and for employment at the port to be prioritized for residents of Red Sea state, after 13 workers from Khartoum were given jobs. [size=no report]
Around 29 March 2021 (as reported), health workers marched in Kadugli town (Kadugli locality, South Kordofan state), denouncing frequent attacks against health workers. [size=no report]
On 29 March 2021, demonstrators began a sit-in protest at Buram town (Buram locality, South Darfur state), calling for improvements to health care and infrastructure in the area. [size=no report]

On 29 March 2021, Amhara militia clashed with SAF and SAF reservists at an unspecified location along the international border with Ethiopia in southern Basundah locality (Gedaref state) [coded to Karima], after the militia attempted to remove Sudanese border markers. Two were killed in the clash (one from each side).

On 28 March 2021, two farmers (a father and son) were shot and killed near Kortala (Habila locality, South Kordofan state), and their bodies dumped in a nearby forest. The cause of the killings is unknown.

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Sudan (2019-) Military Intelligence Service
notes: Around 28 March 2021 (as reported), SAF and SAF Military Intelligence forces clashed with Amhara militia at or near to Malkamo (El Quresha locality, Gedaref state). The source suggest the militia were involved in people smuggling efforts, and killed 4 of the civilians they were smuggling, although the details on this point are vague.

On 27 March 2021, police clashed with 'people smugglers' (provisionally coded as Ethiopian) at an unspecified area implied to be in Eastern El Galabat locality (Gedaref state) [coded to Sundus]. The report does indicate that any injuries were sustained by either party.
On 27 March 2021, a tribal leader from an unspecified Arab-identifying group from West Darfur was reportedly murdered at his apartment in Khartoum (Khartoum state). There is no further information.

Around 26 March 2021, residents of Wadi Al-Ashar in Haya locality (Red Sea state) demonstrated at the entrance to the Kush Mining camp [coded to Haya], blocking the entrance through unspecified means. The demonstrators are protesting against the lack of investment in the area by the mining company. The demonstrators began a sit-in protest which has lasted at least 4 days. [size=no report]

On 26 March 2021, demonstrators began a sit-in protest at the Sharif Oil Field in Adila locality (East Darfur state), shutting off production. The protest comes amid similar demonstrations at oil fields in the state, which have denounced the lack of economic contribution made by the oil sector to local communities, and drawn attention to environmental harm. [size=no report]
On 26 March 2021, militiamen on motorbikes opened fire on a tuk tuk in the Kunjara area of Nertiti locality (Central Darfur state), wounding one passenger. There is no further information.

On 25 March 2021, militiamen of the disbanded Popular Defence Forces intercepted a passenger vehicle at a river just outside of the town of Abu Kershola (Abu Kershola locality, South Kordofan state), robbing the passengers, and killing the driver after he claimed not to be carrying any money. The PDF militiamen then left the scene.

Around 25 March 2021 (as reported), students blocked roads with burning tires in Gedaref city (Gedaref locality, Gedaref state), denouncing the decision of the University of Gedaref to close two departments. [size=no report]

actor1: Military Forces of Sudan (2019-) Military Intelligence Service
notes: Weapons seizure: Around 25 March 2021 (as reported), SAF Military Intelligence seized around 700 small arms and 28,000 rounds of ammunition at Gmeza (El Quresha locality, Gedaref state), and arrested four people of unspecified nationality. The seizure comes amid ongoing clashes with Ethiopian Amhara forces in the area.

On 25 March 2021, various labor groups - including bank workers and pharmacists - demonstrated at the Council of Ministers in Khartoum (Khartoum state), demanding an improvement in employment conditions. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Amhara Regional Special Forces
notes: On 24 March 2021, SAF reservists clashed with Amhara militias 'backed by the Ethiopian army forces from the Amhara region' (event presumed to have involved Amhara Liyu Police, pending further information) in the areas of Zura and Shy Biet (Basundah locality, Gedaref state. Approximate coordinates for Shy Biet used). Several Amhara militiamen were killed or wounded (unknown fatalities coded as 3 fatalities), and weapons and unspecified agricultural equipment seized.

On 23 March 2021, Chadian gunmen on motorbikes fired upon Sudanese civilians near Dukeit (El Geneina locality, West Darfur state), killing a teenager and wounding a child. There is no clear motivation for the attack.
On 23 March 2021, former employees of the Refugee Commission demonstrated in Khartoum (Khartoum state), calling for their reinstatement. [size=no report]

Around 23 March 2021, demonstrators (including Resistance Committee members) began a sit-in protest in El Taweisha town (El Taweisha locality, North Darfur state), in protest at water shortages and the collapse of the local health system. [size=no report]

On 22 March 2021, demonstrators gathered in Khartoum (Khartoum state), calling for the Minister of Energy and Oil to visit East Darfur, amid a wave of protests at the oil fields in the state. [size=no report]

Around 22 March 2021 (as reported), an unknown group intercepted an ambulance in Hajar El Muk suburb in eastern Kadugli town (Kadugli locality, South Kordofan state). The group fired live rounds into the air, and abducted several ambulance staff. There is no clear motive for the abductions.

Around 22 March 2021 (as reported), an unknown group (presumed to be Sudanese) killed a Misseriya pastoralist in unclear circumstances, at a remote location described as being 10km west of Lake Jau (Talodi locality, South Kordofan state). The border crossing with South Sudan has been closed after the killing.

On 22 March 2021, demonstrators began a sit-in protest at Warsi oil field in Abu Karinka locality (East Darfur state) [coded to Abu Karaynka], shutting off production. The protest comes amid similar demonstrations at oil fields in the state, which have denounced the lack of economic contribution made by the oil sector to local communities, and drawn attention to environmental harm. [size=no report]

On 22 March 2021, demonstrators gathered in Azerni (Kreinik locality, West Darfur state) calling for security to provided in the area, following an attack the previous day. Demonstrators (presumed to be Masalit) blocked roads with burning tires. [size=no report]

Around 22 March 2021 (as reported), medical students from the Sudan University of Science and Technology in Khartoum (Khartoum state) demonstrated against poor facilities at the University, and specifically lack of access to a training hospital or morgue. [size=no report]

On 21 March 2021, two unknown gunmen attacked a Mosque at Azerni (Kreinik locality, West Darfur state), wounding between two and four people (all victims presumed to be Masalit). There is no further information.

On 21 March 2021, an unknown militia group entered Kalma IDP Camp (Nyala locality, South Darfur state), firing live rounds into the camp. No injuries were reported in the attack, which is the latest in a series of similar attacks.
On 21 March 2021, students demonstrated against water shortages in El Obeid (Shiekan locality, North Kordofan state). [size=no report]
Around 21 March 2021, regular forces (presumed to be SAF) assaulted and killed a doctor in Wad Medani (Greater Wad Madani locality, El Gazira state), whilst they were robbing him.
On 21 March 2021, demonstrations broke out in Wad Medani (Greater Wad Madani locality, El Gazira state), after a doctor was killed by security forces. [size=no report]

On 21 March 2021, unknown gunmen entered the house of a Hausa omda (a community leader) at Elfaid Um Abdalla in Abu Kershola locality (South Kordofan state), shooting him in the face before fleeing. The victim survived the attack and was taken to two medical facilities, but died as a result of their injuries during the week beginning 12 April 2021.

On 21 March 2021, dozens of medical students from East Kordofan University travelled to Khartoum (Khartoum state) to begin a sit-in protest at the Ministry of Higher Education, to denounce the poor quality of studies and continued breaks in the semester. [size=dozens]

On 20 March 2021, three civilians (presumed to be Sudanese) were stabbed and beaten by an unknown group (also presumed to be Sudanese) after crossing into Sudan from Chad at an unspecified location, implied to be in El Geneina locality (West Darfur) [coded to Dumej]. The victims are recovering in El Geniena hospital.
On 20 March 2021, employees of the Saudi-Sudanese Bank demonstrated in Khartoum (Khartoum state), calling for the formation of the Board of Directors. [size=no report]

On 18 March 2021, medical students began a sit-in protest at the University in Ad Douiem (El Douiem locality, White Nile state). The students are demonstrating against what they regard as unfair exam scores as well as poor quality living conditions. Students are also calling for the Dean to resign. [size=no report]

Around 18 March 2021, demonstrators began a sit-in protest at Warsi oil field at the Sufyan Petro-Energy Camp in Abu Karinka locality (East Darfur state), shutting off production. The protesters denounced the lack of economic contribution made by the oil sector to local communities, and drew attention to environmental harm. [size=no report]

actor1: Military Forces of Sudan (2019-) Military Intelligence Service
notes: Defusal: On 18 March 2021, SAF Military Intelligence and Engineers defused an explosive device in a farm near an oil pipeline running through Suakin locality (Red Sea state). There is no information regarding who placed the device there.

Looting: Around 17 March 2021 (as reported), soldiers from regular forces (and coded as SAF) alongside unknown armed men were reported to have been involved in the looting of farms in Western and Eastern El Galabat localities (Gedaref state) [coded to Doka]. The source implies the looters are exploiting the recent violence in the disputed El Fashaga region.

On 17 March 2021, a violent cattle raid occurred in the Shergeila area of Tullus locality (South Darfur state), in which at least 200 head of cattle were stolen. The Fellata and Rizeigat are involved in the incident, though it is unclear who was raiding and who was raided. Divergent accounts say that 'multiple injuries' occurred and/or that 2, 10, or 12 people were killed (unknown fatalities coded as zero pending confirmation).

On 16 March 2021, students of Omdurman Islamic University in Omdurman (Umm Badda locality, Khartoum state) once again demonstrated against the killing of a fellow student two days prior (by suspected criminals). [size=no report]

Around 16 March 2021 (as reported), striking health workers from a medical laboratory demonstrated in Khartoum (Khartoum state), after military forces had earlier attempted to break their strike. [size=no report]

On 16 March 2021, unknown communal militiamen from Darfur entered Kalma IDP Camp (Nyala locality, South Darfur state), firing weapons, and wounding a displaced woman who resides in the camp. There is no clear motive for the attack; a pro-SLM/A al Nur IDP group has accused the governor of South Darfur of building a militia for the purpose of forcibly clearing out the camp.

On 15 March 2021, patients from the kidney hospital in Omdurman (Umm Badda locality, Khartoum state) demonstrated against declining quality of care at the hospital, after four patients died due to a lack of drugs. The protesters are calling for the dismissal of the director. [size=no report]

On 15 March 2021, demonstrators from the Hausa ethnic group marched in Kassala city (Kassala locality, Kassala state), calling for the inclusion of the group in forthcoming appointments for public prosecutor roles (reserved for 'indigenous' groups under the Juba Peace Agreement), whilst calling for a rethink of the JPA. Police closed the main bridge, and fired tear gas at the demonstrators. [size=no report]
On 15 March 2021, residents of El Obeid (Shiekan locality, North Kordofan state) began a sit-in demonstration, in protest at soaring prices of water. [size=no report]
On 14 March 2021, hundreds of expatriates (of unspecified nationalities) demonstrated in Khartoum (Khartoum state) against increasing charges attached to financial transfers. [size=hundreds]
On 14 March 2021, youth (including students) demonstrated against deteriorating cell phone reception in Atbara (Atbara locality, River Nile state). [size=no report]
On 14 March 2021, unknown gunmen killed a man (implied to be an IDP) at his home in Nertiti town (Nertiti locality, Central Darfur state). There is no further information.
On 14 March 2021, youth (including students) demonstrated against deteriorating cell phone reception in Khartoum (Khartoum state). [size=no report]

On 14 March 2021, students of Omdurman Islamic University in Omdurman (Umm Badda locality, Khartoum state) demonstrated after a fellow student was killed earlier that day (by suspected criminals). The demonstrators marched to a hospital and to the funeral of the deceased. [size=no report]

On 13 March 2021, armed pastoralists attacked Amar Allah village (Kutum locality, North Darfur state. Approximate location based on description from source used at GP2), firing weapons, before beating and whipping three IDPs who were gathering firewood in the area.

On 13 March 2021, a SAF officer pursued a truck driver who he had earlier had an altercation with at Daim-Mansour, and intercepted him at Bashir Nugu (El Kurmuk locality, Blue Nile state). The soldier severely beat and threatened to kill the victim, who later reported the incident to authorities to no avail. The attack is described as being motivated by the driver's ethnicity, which is unspecified.

source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Dabanga; Radio Tamazuj
notes: On 13 March 2021, suspected Misseriya gunmen fired at a commercial vehicle travelling between Abyei town and Amieth Market in the disputed Abyei area, killing the driver and wounding three or four others. One source says the driver refused to stop after the gunmen indicated for him to do so.

Around 12 March 2021 (as reported), health workers demonstrated in Rabak town (Rabak locality, White Nile state) and/or Kosti town across the Nile, against the failure of authorities to provide additional funds as part of an infection allowance. [size=no report]

On 12 March 2021, looters descended on the former UNAMID base outside Manawashi (Marshang locality, South Darfur state), which had been handed over to the Sudanese government in late February. Unspecified Sudanese forces (coded as army) fired upon the looters, wounding 7, and recovered the majority of the stolen items. [size=no report]

On 12 March 2021, students began a sit-in demonstration at the University in El Roseires (El Roseires locality, Blue Nile state), after a robbery took place at the female student dormitory. The demonstrators are calling increased security. [size=no report]

On 12 March 2021, two unspecified tribal groups clashed in front of the court house at Zalingei city (Zalingei locality, Central Darfur state), during a trial relating to the killing of a soldier from one of the groups. Unspecified security forces (coded as army) fired weapons to disperse the groups. It is not specified whether the groups were armed, and the event is presumed to have been a fist-fight. [size=no report]

Around 11 March 2021 (as reported), demonstrators gathered in Nyala city (Nyala locality, South Darfur state), denouncing efforts by parts of the local government to encroach on historic land of archaeological significance in the area. [size=no report]
On 11 March 2021, a male IDP was shot and wounded at his home in the Karli camp area of Kass town (Kass locality, South Darfur state). There is no further information.

On 10 March 2021, students and Resistance Committee members demonstrated in Atbara city (Atbara locality, River Nile state), calling for justice for those killed during the uprising and the 2007 killings of demonstrators protesting the construction of the Kabjur dam. [size=no report]

On 10 March 2021, demonstrators protested in Khartoum (Khartoum state) against the closure of branches of the Bank of Khartoum (which were closed as of 9 March due to strike action, related to the dismissal of employees on corruption charges). The demonstrators have been unable to access remittance payments. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_2: RAC: Revolutionary Awakening Council; Rizeigat Ethnic Group (Sudan)

Musa Hilal - who is linked to numerous atrocities in Darfur - was dramatically arrested in North Darfur in 2017, amid a widening rift between Musa Hilal and then-President Omar al Bashir, and competition with the RSF paramilitary leader 'Hemedti' for control of lucrative gold mines and trading routes.

There is no information regarding fatalities or casualties.

Around 9 March 2021 (as reported), members of the PCP demonstrated in Nyala city (Nyala, South Darfur state), calling for the release of an imprisoned member of the party, and for transitional authorities to take steps to improve dire economic conditions in the country. [size=no report]

On 9 March 2021, residents of Gereida town (Gereida locality, South Darfur state) demonstrated against violence and insecurity in the area, and began a sit-in protest in the town.
